The screen is bright, clear, and rich while the backlit keyboard helps for typing in dark environments.It's about 2 pounds lighter than my previous laptop and significantly thinner, and what I'd consider to be portable. Ill be using it at college next year and will report back on just how portable it is.Graphics, processing, and RAM are all lightning fast and should be useful in intensive software that ill be using. The only problem I've noticed is that after partitioning the hard drive, startup takes a little longer (around 22 seconds total).The power cord is portable and extendable, while its nice to still have the optical drive, Ethernet port, and card slot. Only having 2 USB ports so close in proximity is a minor issue with larger thumb drives, etc. but I may just purchase a separate hub.All in all, you won't regret buying this. The higher cost will pay off well in a long computer life. Thanks for reading and feel free to ask any questions.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Taylor B
Reviews.Content: FAST, QUITE, AMAZING.I am 17 and took a risk with my savings and finally bought a computer for my senior year in high school. I wanted a computer that was quite, fast, and that had overall great performance. This is it. Why not 5 stars? Well the battery lasts about 5 hours, I think when they mean 7 they mean on the darkest setting etc.... It should be up to 7 hours. Amazing comp, you won't be disappointed, cannot wait to take to college.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Jimmy C. Murray
Reviews.Content: This was a present for my Grandson's Graduation. His first Apple product, He really likes it, just now getting familiar with how to properly operate it. I have several Apple products, love the products.

Reviews.Title: I love this machine!!!
Reviews.Author: Luis B. Mora
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the MacBook Pro that has not been said already. I bought this Mac in order to replace my old Dell laptop. I primarily use the computer for school, but it can easily handle extensive tasks (video editing, photoshop etc.) as well. The battery life is good usually averaging between 6-7 hours. I was surprised to discover that this machine can do gaming also, it runs League of Legends and Team Fortress 2 at 60 FPS on the native 1280x800 resolution. OS X is really great at letting you multi-task with ease. I would recommend increasing the ram in order to increase performance on your machine. I installed a 16GB ram kit from Crucial and I noticed an immediate increase in performance. The backlit keyboard is amazing to type on. I have typed for hours and have yet to feel fatigued. The MacBook Pro is a great product which can meet the needs of the average consumer. For those wondering whether to get the MacBook Air or the Pro I would recommend buying the Pro. The MacBook Pro (non-retina) is easily customizable, just buy a SSD and ram and you will have a blazing fast machine in your hands. I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: Exelent
Reviews.Author: Gonzalo
Reviews.Content: I bought it, and I received in time, the Mac was like the ad says. The machine is used, but is like new, i'm very impress. I strongly recomen EZ (the seller). Because I receive the machine, and a I had a question for the password, and they respond me immediately.

Reviews.Title: Amazing laptop!
Reviews.Author: vano
Reviews.Content: I needed a new laptop for school and looked around for a lot of different models. Looked at HP, ASUS, Acer, Sony and a bunch of other ones but could not find I really liked. This MacBook Pro might is pricey but  I wanted to go with a laptop that had great reviews and this was it.Being a Windows user for 10+ years I wasn't sure if I was going to like the Mac operating system. But once I started using it I got the hang of it in less than a day. OS is built really well and easy to use.I installed 8gigs of RAM on it myself (was super easy) and it can handle tons of windows/tabs open, and shows no signs of being slowed down, for when I write my research papers. I am sure it could do just as well with the basic 4gigs of RAM it comes with but for around $50, 8gigs of RAM is a cheap upgrade. Really fast laptop.Laptop looks and feels great. Keyboard responds well to presses. Track pad is amazing. Responds great to touch. Other track pads I have used have been finicky. AMAZING battery life. I can go ~8 hours on a single charge with no keyboard lit and screen lit at 25%If your a student and can spare the money, buy this laptop; you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: WOW - Love the Apple MacBook Pro!
Reviews.Author: linda l.
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this MacBook Pro, programs, style, size, and the packing.What a surprise when it shipped in one day. Thx, Amazon for the speedy delivery. I stayed up half the night enjoying my new MacBook Pro.

Reviews.Title: perfect graduation gift!
Reviews.Author: carol Sweeney
Reviews.Content: The ultimate graduation gift. It is light weight and the perfect size to carry to class. I will go off to LSU well prepared.

Reviews.Title: Works like a charm
Reviews.Author: Richard T. Chislett
Reviews.Content: After 25 years living in the PC world, and having my last notebook only lasting 6 months, I decided to go to the dark side and purchase a Mac. The battery life is excellent, the display is excellent, and downloading apps is a  breeze. I would recommend this to any one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome machine.
Reviews.Author: Subjective Objective
Reviews.Content: I am a PhD student, and I need my computer to handle everything from Photoshop to Pymol, and LaTEX to InDesign, and this notebook works perfectly. The battery lasts as advertised (give or take 15-20 minutes), and the entire user experience is very elegant. I like the little quirks of the latest operating system as well (full screen mode!). I had a Powerbook G4 11.6" before, and that little beast lasted nearly 6 years (one battery change, RAM upgraded later), and the build quality on that computer was awesome. I mean I accidentally dropped it multiple times, had minor spills on the keyboard, and it still went strong. Finally, it was slowing down considerably last year, and the fan noise kept getting louder, so I was looking for a new laptop. I have always been a fan of Apple laptop's build quality, and the friendliness of the operating system. I am a proficient user of Windows as well, but I always find that the hardware manufacturers always let the operating system down. I compared the quality of Sony Vaio 15" S series computer at a local Microsoft Store (with Signature), and though the prices for both the Mac and Sony Vaio were very similar, the overall computing experience was far superior on a Mac.I have used this computer for quite a while now, and this computer works very well. No glitches, no hang-ups - nothing but smoothness. I highly recommend this computer to any new buyer. Once this laptop has served its purpose (a few years time, perhaps), I will definitely stick with Macs. I am definitely eyeing the Mac 13.3" with Retina Display.

Reviews.Title: best laptop ever
Reviews.Author: echo
Reviews.Content: It is wonderful to Buy this laptop from Apple and this is the first time for me to use the system Apple and has no regrets about transformative for Apple. this model especially very distinctive by its potentials wonderful lightweight also I transpire this device for those interested in is speed in performance at the expense of screen resolutionas in Retina display.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely LOVE it!
Reviews.Author: B. Stallman
Reviews.Content: Yeah, it's super expensive. I'm pretty sure when I bought it, my bank account went 'ouch!' But it's so worth it! I used to be a solid HP person. I loved the way they ran and wasn't a fan of my sister's Macbook Air. But after one busted computer, and another HP that crashed no less than four times (no joke, it was RIDICULOUS) I decided that an Apple was the way to go. I chose the pro because I definitely wanted the cd drive included with the computer. I LOVE IT! Definitely worth the extra money. It's fast, super user friendly, and easier to personalize. I had to use my old hp shortly after purchasing this and couldn't stand it! Once you go Mac, you won't go back!

Reviews.Title: MacBook Pro is exactly what I expected
Reviews.Author: Woops72
Reviews.Content: I needed to upgrade to Lion but my old platform (MacBook vintage 2008/9) was not upgradable.  It was also suffering from hardware (keyboard) issues, relatively slow performance and shortening battery lifetime.  I chose the MBP over the MacAir because of the extra ports, DVD burner, etc, accepting the extra weight which was not that important to me.  I love the new platform, though it took some getting used to with the Launch Pad and Command Center paradigms.Con:  The only small complaint I have is the power cord attachment to the laptop.  It has a 90 degree bend in it that either requires the cord to bend along (and partially cover) the various ports on the side of the laptop or bend away to the rear which generates a long loop for me the way I plug it it with the possibility of accidentally popping out.Pro:  Besides delivering the higher level performance that I expected of the new platform, the display on the MBP is much better than my old MacBook which had a poor quality display with a waviness I never liked and poor off-angle viewability.

Reviews.Title: A great laptop for the money
Reviews.Author: Vikram Jairam
Reviews.Content: Pros: Fast CPU. Upgradeable to 16GB Memory. We also remove the Superdrive and put a 750GB Seagate Momentus XT (Hybrid) Drive in the machine. Performance is great for iOS development and running Windows for essential stuff under bootcamp, or fusion.Cons: Screen resolution. Apple should provide either 1080p or retina display. Should be possible in today's market because LCD's have gotten cheaper. They dont move with the times. the non-retina MBP models have stagnated for too long.

Reviews.Title: VERY POWERFUL MACHINE
Reviews.Author: Mr. S Berry
Reviews.Content: Ok before I purchased this computer last July, I owned an 2009 white MacBook that was an introductory  low end MacBook , it was 2g of ram and 160 gb HDD so going from that to an actual PROFESSIONAL machine is amazing .USB 3.0 is a beast , the 500GB HDD Is amazing and I also SELF upgraded the ram from there stock 4g to an 8gig . My machine is amazing this is my favorite model because the new retina MacBook Pro  is not self upgradable AT ALL . so I enjoyed upgrading my computer on my terms instead of apple overcharging their upgrade on order section.But overall if your a creative type or a business professional this is an absolute MUST BUY as I guarantee satisfaction , great durability , nice software with Mountain Lion , sdx card slot , you will a very happy customer. I have had this computer since early July 2012 and I have had no issues OF ANY KIND . NO BUYERS REGRET OVER HERE.

Reviews.Title: STILL GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Serbin
Reviews.Content: I have a refurbished Black MacBook that I bought in 2007 from the Apple online store. I wanted to explore what the Mac was all about. 6+ years later it's still working just fine, but with a limit of 2 gig of RAM, it was getting a bit slow and behind the times.It's nice to see Apple still making a laptop with a DVD/CD drive. The price from Amazon was GREAT, so, I had to order it. The buying experience was good. However my experience with UPS was a 0 on a scale of 0-10. The driver did not knock on my door, left a post it note notice. I went to UPS that night. The driver had checked in and they could not find the box. I was told it would be at Pick Up the next day. I went back the next day, they could not locate it, and discovered that it was on the truck. I missed the driver by 3 minutes. He did leave it with a neighbor, and if I had not found the driver who was exiting the apartment complex, i would have had no idea where he left it. Bad UPS, BAD.Anywho, back to the MacBook Pro. While the screen is not Retina, it is still superb. Far superior to my MacBook. The build quality is typical Apple, solid, solid, solid. The SuperDrive is quiet. Sound quality is very acceptable.I haven't had it long enough to test battery life, but I will assume that up to 7 hours is realistic.The Intel i7 processor and 8 gig of RAM makes this a great desktop replacement.Based on my time with the Black MacBook I decided to take out Apple Care. It did come in hand once way back when and more than paid for itself the first and only time I used it. By the way, the Black MacBook is still running strong. All I needed to do for it was replace the battery in February 2013 as it had swelled.The MacBook Pro may look pricy at first, but due to the build quality, parts used and it having an aluminum body, I can see this one lasting 7 years or more. In that light, the 13.3" MacBook Pro is very reasonable in price and a winner in performance. And with Parallels 8 I am also using Windows 98SE, XP and 7 on my MacBook Pro. All run as if they were on a native Windows desktop machine. The 8 gig of RAM and the i7 processor make running virtual software a snap. With the latest MacBook Pro I actually have 4 computers in one. The latest version of OS X, and three versions of Windows. Combined with the SuperDive, great battery life, a crisp display and solid build quality, I am a very pleased user.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Juan Camilo Quintero De los Rios
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Excellent performance. The OS is great. I play Counter Strike Global Offensive on it and it was great. Only have to worry about using it. Definitively, I recommend this!

Reviews.Title: First Macbook
Reviews.Author: greendayrules
Reviews.Content: This is my first Apple computer and I am so pissed off I didn't do it sooner! From a windows computer to this is not a hard process. As long as you know how to use a computer you will be fine. I took me sometime to get used to the new system but definitely worth it! If you ever need to know anything just google it! It is lightning fast and the 500gb memory is more than enough.

Reviews.Title: From PC
Reviews.Author: Kwanza
Reviews.Content: This computer is like...I'm lost for words.This is the best switch I have ever done.I came from a Dell Inspiron, I also paid about $1000 for it.This has much more memory and ram memory.Even the battery life is like WOW!I love, LOVE, LOOOOVE!

Reviews.Title: I'm Sold..
Reviews.Author: William O. Slack "DaRev"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use with a Presonus board and Toon Track Easy Drummer for our worship team. I've been a PC guy from the start - but experiencing the quality (a METAL case - not plastic - METAL!) and the ease of use, my next laptop will be a MAC - I hate to admit it!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Jonathan L. Smith "Jonsmith2282"
Reviews.Content: Always love the way the Mac works. The best part was transferring files from one to another. Connected them to the network, and everything transfers, files, settings, programs. It was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: NICE MACHINE!
Reviews.Author: EeeVee "Another reader"
Reviews.Content: My grand daughter attends Kent State University. Seems the whole school... at an academic level... is going paperless. She had a PC. All of her professors and instructors use Macintosh.Knowing that I am a Mac fan-boy, it was a no-brainer that she asked me for this as a Christmas present.When the MacBook Pro arrived, I helped her transfer all of her schoolwork from the PC to the Mac... an easy drag-and-drop process utilizing a flash drive.It was delivered with 4GB of RAM -- 2GB on each of two sticks -- which was probably adequate. However, I always recommend at least 8 gigs, so I ordered 8 gigs from Amazon. When the RAM arrived, all 8 gigs were on one stick. So I simply pulled one 2GB stick from the machine and installed the 8GB stick in its place. The machine now has 10 gigs of RAM and it works just fine. But, hey, it's an Apple. I wouldn't expect anything less!

Reviews.Title: New laptop for my college student
Reviews.Author: MarkusMN "MarkusMN"
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Macbook Pro and this one is an exceptional value in my opinion.Macs are not the cheapest machines, but they simply work and last.  I have two of thismodel, one 15" model and the new 13" Retina display model.When considering a Mac, look at the total cost of ownership and not just the initial price tag.They seem to hold their value well and I just don't have any problems with them.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Michael Miller
Reviews.Content: Great product, Great price. Stop living in the stone age and buy a mac, you will not be sorry at all!!!

Reviews.Title: best laptop computer made
Reviews.Author: Chipbuilder1
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for myself and I just love it.  I purchase replacement ram and maxed it out at 16Gig.  It is extremely fast and does everything you need in a computer.

Reviews.Title: It doesn't get any better
Reviews.Author: Srdjan
Reviews.Content: Got it as a present from my wife for my birthday few monts ago, and I couldn't be more satisfied.Once you get used to it if you haven't used mac before, you'll be enjoying best computer experience in your life!What is there not to like?Thin, light, pretty, quality built, awesome battery life, fast, reliable,multi touch gestures(saves so much time, so easy to organise).Not to mention software, beats Windows down to it's knees.You wont regret extra few $ spent on this, in fact we liked it so much that we decided to get another one right after.Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Perfecto product
Reviews.Author: Hazael Abraham Hurtado (haza)
Reviews.Content: Best computer in market, I really recomend this product to people working on music or graphic design works.... Good resolution, no anoying noises, BEST!!Take care.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Andrés Salazar Larco
Reviews.Content: if yo like practicality this is the laptop for you. Small size but extremely powerful, osx mountain lion is a great OS

Reviews.Title: good laptop
Reviews.Author: Shawn S
Reviews.Content: If you want this, get this!only con is the high price, but compared to other cheaper options...this is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Staying in touch
Reviews.Author: RickyB
Reviews.Content: The MacBook was needed as a replacement.  The product has more than met the requirements and will be well used. I would recommend this to friends and family members. Thank you

Reviews.Title: This is an absolutely awesome computer.
Reviews.Author: Florence Thompson "F. P. Thompson"
Reviews.Content: The only drawback that I have found to purchasing something this expensive on line is that no one offers you any advice, any insurance, or any technical support.  I have spent a small fortune buying teaching books. All you get is a box and a computer.  After the computer comes, you are completely on your own to figure out everything.  Because I still have a couple of Windows computers, it is easy to go running back to those.  Gradually, I am getting used to the new operating system.

Reviews.Title: From a PC user to Apple; LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: John Ruff
Reviews.Content: After trying win 8; I'm glad I bought this! Plus it connects with all my other devices; so I can display it on my big screen wirelessly via Apple TV, iPad, iPad mini, and iPod touch are all in sync and if I lose or break one, its all in the cloud! From someone who was all ab PC and saying I would never own apple- I'm glad I came to my senses... And with my business, it's invaluable!

Reviews.Title: You get what's expected
Reviews.Author: Magali  Vaz
Reviews.Content: I'm not reviewing the technical specifications / features of a MacBook Pro, there are thousands of websites & magazines that do that. This is my second MBP & when the apple webstore cancelled my older, Amazon came in & delivered. It came quicklly & was packed well. Been five months of intensive use & I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: The best
Reviews.Author: AKVHutch
Reviews.Content: Haven't really had much opportunity to work with this, but thus far it is great.  Compared to the Windows 8 upgrade I just did getting this machine ready to go is a snap.  Only took about an hour of time to load & upgrade everything I wanted initially.  Try doing that with Windows.  I am a former Windows person, but I am quickly moving to a MAC

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer for photography purposes. I needed a laptop with big storage, a nice screen and fast so I can photoshop without any problem. It suits me perfectly for what I need and I'm very satisfied with this purchase.I don't give it the 5 starts because of the weight factor. It's quite heavy so I try to never move it around. I guess that if you need it more as a stationary computer, it'll be alright. Bought this one instead of the air because of the storage. And besides you can watch movies with any DVD ;) which you can't do on an air laptop.I don't know about the other technical facts, but for an average user like myself, you won't be disappointed if you get this laptop as long as you don't have to carry it around too much.

Reviews.Title: Another Great Product from Apple
Reviews.Author: Dennis Meek
Reviews.Content: We got the Apple MacBook Pro 13.3 to replace an aging iMac. The iMac is still functioning for the kids and still works great after 8 years. The issue is we can no longer upgrade to the newest version of OSX thus we don't get the benefits of the new features. The new MBP offers great portability and gives us confidence that we are not going to need to purchase a new laptop in 18 months. Something we did often when we purchased Windows based laptops.Apple OSX is simple to use and has a more enjoyable and intuitive interface than the new Windows 8. I'm not saying it's for everyone but it's a great solution if you want a simple to use device that you know won't be at the end of it's life cycle in a couple of years.Pros-Great functionality-Integration with iCloud and many of the apps you use on an iPad and iPhone.-Log battery life even with wifi on and streaming movies via netflix-Very durable unibody case-Still has an optic drive-Mag Safe power cord is a nice touch-Intel i5 processor works very well-The chicklet keyboard is AWESOME!-The single best function is the backlit keyboard. There is nothing worse than trying to work on a plane and not being able to see the keys without an overhead light that blinds you.-The track pad is incredible. I'm a person that will not use a laptop without a mouse. I just don't like trackpad's because they never work right. That is until now. I can easily use the Apple Track Pad without any issues and now I don't even travel with a mouse. My bag just got a little lighter. I do however like the Apples Magic Mouse but I really don't need it.-It just works. We found that out when our new MBP found all the office and home printers, installed drivers and started working with no effort on our part.Cons-Heavy compared to Ultrabook laptopsRecommendations: I would definitely recommend 8 Gigabytes of RAM. Just because the processor is a 64bit architecture and can efficiently utilize the RAM. I wouldn't by the factory RAM just because it's expensive. Amazon has a nice selection of RAM from various suppliers that will work. We went with the Corsair Vengeance 8GB (2x4GB) DDR3 1600 MHz (PC3 12800) Laptop Memory (CMSX8GX3M2A1600C9).If you have never installed RAM in a Mac Laptop go out on YouTube and watch a couple of videos. It's very easy to do but it's nice to have someone walk you through it first to get a little confidence.

Reviews.Title: Amazingly awesum
Reviews.Author: Dr.Rocki
Reviews.Content: Have been using Windows laptops for my entire life. So, I thought why not give Mac Book pro a try. From the time I opened the box, I am truly amazed by the built quality and screen. I had a misconception that switching from Windows to Mac is tough, but it's really not that bad. I am loving my new Mac Book.Pros:-Amazing design and built quality.-Awesum screen-Extremely good back-lit keyboard.Cons:- A bit higher price tag (which is really worth).- Switching from Windows to Mac may take some time.

Reviews.Title: Just the best!
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I'm Not exagerating when I say this computer is perfect..i It is!! It's small but powerful, light but strong, elegant and beautiful... In resume: it's a Mac! I recomend it without any doud!

Reviews.Title: Macbook Pro Review
Reviews.Author: Ben Miller
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this model of the macbook pro. I can say that I am fully satisfied with the performance that the computer has supplied. It contains a long battery life, incredible specs, and an overall enjoyable performance. Upgrading from a toshiba laptop, I am fully impressed with all of the benefits that the mac operating system provides. The snappy processor allows for me to quickly upload photos and videos, as well as create movies for me and my colleagues to enjoy. In upgrading to this computer I can say I have found little to any flaws in the product, hence the 5 star review.

Reviews.Title: Saved $200 from buying at the Apple store.
Reviews.Author: Peter Konicek "Peter Konicek"
Reviews.Content: Bough this product a while back and so far no problems. With no problems,  I'm happy with this purchase because I saved money compared to buying it anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: Not disappointed in my first Apple product
Reviews.Author: EddieK
Reviews.Content: I've been looking to purchase a new laptop for the past year.  During that time I zeroed in on the 13.3" MacBook Pro and finally took the plunge of owning my first Apple product.  Initial impressions are what most people describe, excellent build quality, very good screen resolution(non-retina), quick boot up, and intuitive controls.  Instead of ridding my hard drive of unwanted garbage that has no use and uses up valuable resources(i.e windows) I'm off surfing the web in literally minutes after taking this product out of the box.  It's fluid, lag-free, whisper quiet, and just so easy to do whatever you choose to do with it.  I would recommend this product to anyone who's looking for a solid, performance oriented laptop.  It's great resale value only adds to it's long list of attributes.

Reviews.Title: Macbook Pro 13"
Reviews.Author: gregory
Reviews.Content: Great laptop for the money. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a full featured laptop. Compared it to the Macbook Air which is thinner and lighter but has no optical drive and a slower processor. Don't need  a retina display because my old ass needs glasses and I wouldn't notice the difference for all the extra cash.

Reviews.Title: Runs like a bat out of hell!
Reviews.Author: S. Romeo "romeosc"
Reviews.Content: The 15" MBP 2012 is the fastest Mac that I have ever used!I didn't want the Retina one due to most applications don't support yet. In fact I still use manyLegacy programs (Appleworks, FileMaker Pro, Quicken, Photoshop etc)! Because the MBP camewith Lion and included a free upgrade to Mountain Lion, I could not run any of those legacyprograms. I have Pages, Numbers and many other programs that will import the old files, but somecouldn't!The solution was to buy a copy of Snow Leopard Server from Apple for $19 and a copy of Parallels 8 OEMfrom Newegg for $28.I run Snow Leopard in a Virtual Machine on my Macbook Pro and can use ALL of my Legacy programs.I can run any of the current programs on Mountain Lion and run the Legacy programs under Virtualization.I now have the best of both worlds.The USB 3 is FAST!

Reviews.Title: Windows PC convert ... never a regret
Reviews.Author: J. Jordan
Reviews.Content: A discounted price for a new Apple laptop is hard to find from a reputable company....and then there is Amazon to save the day! As for the laptop, this is our 3rd Apple computer in the past 2 years. Prior to that we were die hard Dell / PC fans. After getting sick and tired off all the blue screens, the (what seemed like daily) updates, and the OS lock ups, we decided to give the Mac world a chance. While we have been faced with some limitations regarding software (getting better daily), the problems that are persistent with a Windows PC are all but gone. The huge accolad I can give to Apple is; they just plan work...period. With this laptop in particular, to review it, will take some time as it is pretty fresh out of the box (so far so good though). However, I dont expect it to be any different than the rest...awesome!

Reviews.Title: Fast, great graphic performance, heavy
Reviews.Author: vpduco
Reviews.Content: I work with medical imaging and editing. These files are huge and 3d renderings usually take long to load. The Mac Book Pro 15" with intel 7 is behaving perfectly.It is overpriced, should cost $1800 max, but is still a good purchase for those seeking performance. The ethelnet port and the cd drive are also important. My friend bought the Mac Book Pro with retina display and is having trouble with the absence of those itemsHope its been usefulv

Reviews.Title: From PC to a MAC
Reviews.Author: Dawn H. "SAHM"
Reviews.Content: Finally!  I finally made the switch to MAC!  I am so happy I did!  Yeah, the price is more than a pc, but it's so worth it.This MacBook Pro is fluid and effortless.  It almost feels as though Apple has read my mind.  Everything I do on here is simple.I also recommend the book "The Missing Manual Switching From PC to Mac".  It has shown me a lot of things about my mac.  My mom has owned a mac for years and I've been telling her cool things that her macbook can do.  :)I have the 13" size.  I came from a larger pc, so I was worried that this downsize would bother me.  I can't even tell.  I'm a website designer and I'm able to zoom in when and where I need, if needed.  I work long hours at the computer and this is great!  Now, if I win the lottery I'll get the large thunderbolt display.  But until then, the 13" is perfect for me!I recently found a receipt for my first laptop purchase, I think it was about 6 years ago, and I paid over $1800 for it at that time.  I have always tried to buy the best laptop I could afford, only to be disappointed with them in a very short amount of time.If you can swing the price, buy a macbook.  You'll love it!

Reviews.Title: Dead on Arrival from "Datavision" reseller - Apple repair in 2 days
Reviews.Author: C. Smith
Reviews.Content: MacBook Pro arrived in the mail yesterday dead on arrival. Won't charge, won't start. Datavision (Amazon's reseller - you're not getting it straight from Amazon) informed me that I could take it to a local Apple Store for a "replacement," which is simply incorrect. An Apple Store would attempt to repair this same unit under warranty. My other option was to mail it, insured, AT MY OWN EXPENSE, back to Datavision for an exchange.Extremely disappointed both with the product and the experience buying it from Amazon. I advise buying direct from Apple or choosing a different authorized reseller than Amazon's "Datavision" retailer.Anyway, I've elected to have the Apple Store attempt to repair the unit. I may update the review as the adventure progresses.UPDATE 1/10/13! The Apple Store sent it off under warranty, and it returned in just a couple of days with a new logic board and magsafe (power charger) component in the laptop.SCREEN -Noticeably brighter than my 2006 matte screen MacBook Pro. I was worried about the glossy, reflective screen, but inside at least it's perfect. I have yet to attempt to use it outside. No dead pixels. Great color. No issues.PERFORMANCE, HEAT & NOISE -Very fast. The 2.6 GHz processor, 8 MB of RAM and the 1 gig NVidia 650M graphics card all make a zippy machine. I also like the fact that it has an additional on-board graphics card, and automatically switches between the two as needed to extend battery life and reduce heat output. Overall, runs much, much cooler than my 2006 MacBook Pro.The traditional magnetic hard drive suits my needs just fine - no need for an expensive SSD. This machine lets me edit large photos in Photoshop CS5 quickly and easily, with little to no delay in rendering.The hard drive is very quiet. The optical drive machinery makes more noise than I expected when it takes in a disc, but it reads CDs/DVDs quietly and effectively once it gets started.BODY -The unibody construction really does feel lot more solid than Apple's previous laptops. The screen hinge works well and appears durable.OVERALL RECOMMENDATION -4/5. It's a great machine. Get it if you can afford it. Buy it from Amazon direct, not from another reseller.Why not 5/5? Mine arrived with a dead logic board and no ability to charge the battery--a $2,000 brick. The Apple warranty got it repaired for free in just a couple of days, however. I bought AppleCare and would not be surprised if other parts need replacement over the next three years, just as my previous MacBook Pro had its logic board, topcase, hard drive, battery, and optical drive replaced through Applecare. Apple seems to periodically have bad batches of logic boards, but according to the other customer reviews on Amazon I just got a lemon and the vast majority work perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Machine! Easy transition from Windows.
Reviews.Author: JMX
Reviews.Content: I have been a PC user for most of my life. I used windows XP, windows Vista, and Windows 7 extensively. Most recently, I put Windows 8 on my old Dell laptop in an attempt to breathe new life into it. This plan ended when the hinge holding the screen on finally gave out. I purchased this computer from Amazon during the Black Friday sale, and got a much better deal than Apple was offering. Though the computer ships with Lion instead of the current Mountain Lion OS, the free upgrade that Amazon describes was processed and approved by Apple within about 10 minutes. The computer arrived very well packaged and in perfect condition.Hardware: The Macbook pro's physical form is wonderful. Not only is it beautiful, but it feels really solid. Screen is bright and gorgeous. Trackpad is nothing short of dazzling when compared to competing Windows systems. Wake up time is very short. Sound from concealed speakers perfectly adequate for normal listening.Software: Though I was excited to try Mac, I was a little apprehensive. I have been a PC person for many years and feel really comfortable navigating Windows to accomplish tasks. Not only is Mac different, but Mac programs (in my experience) typically expect you to think in a slightly different way when trying to figure out how to do something new. I was a bit worried that I would experience some frustration. My fears, however, were unfounded. The system is amazingly intuitive, and, after a short learning curve, you begin to feel like Mac is a big improvement over Windows 7, and that Windows 8 is an unsuccessful attempt to recreate Mac successes. For example, I feel like the new Start screen is analogous to the Launchpad, but more cluttered and a bit clunky. Anyway, the transition is not difficult, and the experience trumps Windows easily.WHY THE MACBOOK PRO, WHY NOT THE AIR? I did consider purchasing the Air instead of the Pro. I was attracted to the all flash architecture of the air. Solid state drives don't wear out, even after 5+ years of operation. Also, lugging around a heavy computer just in case I need it is a peeve of mine, with the result that I often don't have my computer when I need it. The Pro is by no means a heavy computer, but the Air is remarkably light. I don't really believe I would have ever missed the optical drive, as I still have a desktop that I can use to burn CDs/DVDs and to store massive files that would overwhelm the relatively small solid state storage of the Air. Why, then, did I get the Pro? Longevity for one. I expect a laptop to last around 5 years at this point. While the base Pro and Air have similar performance ratings, in two years I can open the bottom of the Pro and easily and cheaply upgrade the RAM. I also plan to put in a solid state drive at that time. This can all be done more cheaply than paying Apple for the upgrade right now. Also, though I understand why it may be reasonable to make the Air without an Ethernet cable, my office at the university does not have Wifi. There are no plans to expand coverage to my office and I am not permitted to expand the network on my own. This means I am restricted to ethernet connection. I realize that there are USB and Thunderbolt adapters for this, but I would need to use this adapter literally every day. In the end, I don't think it would be worth the hassle. Also, some users report issues with getting the Air to use these adapters, a situation which would be extremely negative for my work situation even on a short-term basis. In the end, these reasons led me to get the Pro over the Air, and I am highly satisfied with my decision. The relatively greater mass of the Pro is not an issue, as the computer is still highly portable, and not having to mess with the ethernet adapter is a pro that I am already grateful for.Overall, my experience with this computer has been great. I would highly recommend the switch, and I will not be returning to the Windows platform for the foreseeable future.

Reviews.Title: Solid laptop with no noticeable flaws
Reviews.Author: Warhawk
Reviews.Content: My previous Macbook was a 2011 Air, also 13".I bought the base model as I was to upgrade the RAM and HDD myself, and the processor upgrade wasn't worth it to me.Initial thoughts:- Boot-up is much slower than my last Macbook Air because of the HDD instead of an SSD- Screen does look better even tho it has a lower resolution- Keyboard is a tad stiffer than Macbook Air- Hearing the DVD drive spin up every boot-up is strange, but not annoying- Much better graphics and processor performance- Thickness or weight doesn't bother me, since I use it as my main computer- Mic is above the 'esc' key and not next to the fan vent like the Macbook Air- Runs much cooler and quieter- USB slots are next to each other instead of one on each side- Upgraded to 8gb ram(http://www.amazon.com/dp/B004Y4XAAK/ref=pe_175190_21431760_M3T1_SC_dp_1) shortly afterMore Detail:- Boot-up takes around 45 seconds compared to my Macbook Air taking around 15 seconds.  Applications also start slower, instead of almost all my apps opening instantly, it takes 2-3 seconds.  An easy fix to that will be an SSD which I should be getting November sometime and will update this with comparisons.- I compared my roommate's 2011 Macbook Pro 13" to my 2011 Macbook Air 13" before I sold it.  His looked much better, darker blacks, more saturated and warm.  My Air looked stale and not as detailed as his Pro. The resolution is only 1280x800 compared to the 1440x900 of the Macbook Air, but I kind of like that better because text is bigger and I don't have to squint as much(not that I did that much before).- The first time I typed my name and password for the Pro I noticed the keyboard is slightly stiffer. I can say I liked the Macbook Air's keyboard better, but not a lot to be bothered by it.  Having used it for a month now, I don't even notice it anymore.- Having no DVD drive for almost a year was amazing, but frustrating the few times when I needed it. The noise isn't loud when turning on the computer, shouldn't be enough to wake someone up in the same room that is sleeping. Now I can't move my Mac around as fast since it has more moving parts in it, but thats not a big deal for me.- Graphics are much improved.  The comparison Apple gives is 60% improvement over the previous generation, however I went from a 2011 Macbook Air to a 2012 Macbook Pro. I'm not sure if thats more than a 60% improvement as I don't have a 2012 Macbook Air to compare.  Lets just say with my Macbook Air I had to have the lowest settings on Starcraft 2 to play a 3v3 game online and it would still lag later on and dip below 20fps.  WIth my Macbook Pro I can have medium settings on a 3v3 and have a steady 50fps the whole game.  The only time I could have a steady 50fps on high settings was a 1v1 game. However, medium settings look 10x better than low(mainly from shaders), while high settings looks only 2x better than medium.  Other games like Portal 2, Left 4 Dead 2, Torchlight 2(Windows Boot Camp), League of Legends, Half LIfe 2 series, CS:GO, TF2 I could get almost the highest settings(usually excluding AA) and be smooth.  Converting video via Handbrake was also quicker on the Macbook Pro, I don't have a video for proof, but from what I remember it was at least 2x as fast.- I used my Macbook Air for everything including school, work, games, video, music, etc. So it was on my desk 90% of the time.  So naturally moving to a thicker and slightly heavier Macbook Pro had no affect on me.  Even when I use it on my lap while watching TV or helping someone on the XBOX with a game, it doesn't feel like a brick.- My biggest complaint on the Macbook Air was the placement of the mic.  It was right next to the exhaust vent, so when I was playing any game online and using Skype, the other person could hear the fan blasting at a full 6500 rpm.  The mic on the Macbook Pro is now above the 'esc' key and not right next to the fan, much better design decision.  I've played games online and people don't hear the fans anymore.- As I mentioned before, while playing a game on the Macbook Air the fans would climb to 6500 rpm fast and be very loud and quite hot to the touch in the upper left corner of the laptop.  The highest I've seen it on my Macbook Pro is 5300 rpm, and it doesn't always do that.  Strangely enough it would do that on Starcraft 2 then would dip down to about 3000 rpm during a game and I couldn't hear it anymore. So noise is reduced at least 50% and the heat is much better, now it doesn't feel hot but warm.- The USB ports are right next to each other on the left side which is fine by me since my laptop is on the left side of my desk, so everything is out of the way for me.  On my Macbook Air cords would come out of both directions and cause a mess sometimes.  Even if it was the same as the Macbook Air, wouldn't bother me much.  Just be sure to have a USB drive that isn't super thick or you can't fit another next to it.- I was restricted to 4gb of ram on the Macbook Air which I thought would be fine before purchasing.  However I was new to Macs and didn't know that OSX uses a lot more ram than Windows, which is fine because its a lot more responsive, I just wish I had known before hand.  For me, after booting up with no apps open it was taking around 2gb or half the ram already.  Windows used around 500mb-750mb with no apps open.  So if I were playing a game, I couldn't have any other programs open or it would run slower.  I also had to keep track on how many tabs I had open in Chrome or Safari, especially if they had flash content like Youtube.  With 8gb of ram I can have Safari running with several tabs, Mail, Spotify, Preview, Textedit, and Steam open while playing Starcraft 2 and it doesn't slow down at all.- Another random note to mention is the screen bezel is black and not white. I kind of like the black better, especially when playing a game or watching video when the screen is darker.Overall I am extremely satisfied with my purchase and can't wait to get a 256gb SSD and watch this thing fly.That is really the only thing I miss from my last Macbook Air.Will edit my post when I get an SSD and if I find other things I forgot to mention.Hope this review was informative!

Reviews.Title: Another great experience with Apple with a Caveat for Video Editors
Reviews.Author: F. Jones
Reviews.Content: I have kept a MacBook by my easy chair for seven years now to use to look up stuff as I watch TV, travel, etc.  The new MacBook is lightyears ahead of my old white plastic MacBook circa 2006.  The power adapter is much improved and teh backlit keyboard is a nice touch as well.  The only caveat and this goes for all Mac users who may be upgrading and like to make the occasional iMovie.  Apple no longer includes iDVD with the computer and furthermore, Apple doesn't even offer it anymore!  I know Apple believes that DVD and, for that matter, Blu-Ray are dead.  But not offering a media burning solution and leaving us to (gasp!) a third-party solution which we all know don't always work so well.  After all, that is why we have switched to Apple, because they just work.

Reviews.Title: My 1st Mac and I will never go back to Windows.
Reviews.Author: Brian Kling
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable computer. I have used windows computers (Dell, HP, Gateway..) my whole life and once using this Mac I will never go back. Even using a windows computer for a short period of time drives me crazy now that I've used a Mac. No hassles with a Mac. Never freezes, never slows down, battery life is triple that of Dell, HP, ect..

Reviews.Title: Good while works
Reviews.Author: Alvaro Torrado
Reviews.Content: First of all excuse my english, I bought one of this model, very nice PC, nice screen, really fast, but after installing softwares only 4 days of using it i was playing starcraft 2 and hang up, had to do a hard reset after that never boot again, i tried everything i search in google nothing works, took it to apple store they reinstalled the OS charged me 50 $, i had to reinstall everything again, it last 2 weeks, it starts crashing again using cinema 4d and starcraft but always boot again, yesterday crashed last time and doesnt wants to boot, so it looks that i have to reformat again, i have mountain lion DVD and right now doesnt want to start from DVD, i dont want to take it again to apple and charge me another 50 $ to reinstall os, thats 100 $ spent on a new computer after a month ?? my old Asus PC never had to format in 1 and a half year of use. I am big fan of Apple products like iphone and ipad, this is my first Apple Mac, but i think i pay a lot of money for a product that crash too much, i would try to reinstall the OS but if i have to pay another 50 $ on it, i will sell it after that and buy another brand of PC...UPDATE 1:After taking 2 times my macbook pro to the apple store they realized that it came with a damage video card, and that was the problem. After they change it i have been using my macbook pro for almost 6 months now and i am very happy, it is fast, nice screen, really nice OS, i highly recommend it. Thanks to the people who left comments, i am updating this to let you know that my problem was fixed and i am enjoying a really good product...

Reviews.Title: Only one word describes it: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Luz M. Osorio "Sebastian"
Reviews.Content: All my life I've been using Windows computers, from Windows 98 all the way to Windows 7, and let me tell you, Mac OS X Lion is simply astonishing. From the speed to the multi touch gestures this operating system beats Windows easily. If you are hesitant on wether or not to buy this computer let me give you some reasons why you should:1. The speed: Very, very fast, it boots in less than 30 seconds and loads up all your applications and documents flawlessly. Not to mention the 8gb of RAM (Great addition).2. The looks:  The attention to detail on this computer is simply amazing from the aluminum finish, to the little lights on the keyboard, it really is a quality product.3. Its Apple, you know you're getting a reliable product which devaluates very little in time, as you may see any Windows computer goes from being $1300 (A very good one) to around $300 dollars in 2 years. Apple products retain their value and don't devaluate very fast.4. You may find reviews that say "This computer can be beaten by any PC at half the price" but the thruth is you're not only paying for a great quality product, but also one that will really satisfy you for a long time, and one you may sell in 1-2 years for 30% less of its retail (Compared to a PC's 70%)In the end you will find that, if you decide to buy this product, it was totally worth it. Mac's are very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Worked for a little while
Reviews.Author: Marcus
Reviews.Content: I bought it and it worked great for about a month and now it won't turn on. I am not happy with my purchase

Reviews.Title: Best Laptop I've Had
Reviews.Author: The Review Guy
Reviews.Content: I have had a black macbook since 2007. It was getting old and I needed a new school computer. I was looking around and I knew I wanted something fast, able to multitask, and very portable. I also like to play games so I needed some nice graphics. I kept looking at the 15" because it had good graphics and a good processor. But I thought that it was just a tad too big for my needs. I went into the apple store and I was looking at the 13" and I knew that it was perfect. It has a great screen, it is the perfect size, it is not too heavy and it is very powerful (Ivy-Bridge processor :D ). I was not sure about the new Intel HD 4000 graphics but I decided if I could not play may favorite game that it would not be the end of the world. So I got home and I booted it up, put windows 7 on and started my favorite game (Just Cause 2) and it worked!!!! So I am very pleased with my purchase. Overall this computer is perfect for my needs. If you want something with more graphic power I would go with the 15" but if you want something portable and powerful (average user) then this is a perfect laptop.ConsThe screen does not have a high resolution compared to some PC's. (Not that noticeable)It is a bit pricey. Average PC with the same specs = around $800-But an important note is that if you treat your computer well your macbook pro will last a long time. My old Macbook was made from plastic and it still lasted me almost 6 years.  It is still running well not running its more at a walking pace right now but it works. So the price is high but you get a well made computer that will last you years to come!I hoped this helped. I do not do review very often so I am sorry if I did not cover everything.

Reviews.Title: Stylish, cool, and WORTHLESS if you are overseas
Reviews.Author: Alexis A.
Reviews.Content: I bought this brand new July 2012 for my college student daughter.  She claimed it was imperative that she have a MBP for school.  She makes videos for some classes and said Macs are best for this.  She also told me she needed FCP X.  So, I paid out $1500.Power cord failure after 6 months. Common complaint, Google it.About 9 months after purchase the glass monitor cracks.  Of course I thought my daughter had dropped it, but a witness--her grandmother-- said it made a "pop" sound while sitting on the table, and just cracked.  We had to replace that on our dime. Common complaint; Google it.One year after purchase my daughter goes abroad to study.  Shortly thereafter her MBP starts to act up, but can she find anyone to service this computer, on the island where she is living? Of course not. (Note:  the University she is attending is still using FCP 7 and ancient Mac systems; exchange students beware). So I have to FedEx her trusty old Samsung netbook from way back, the same $269 netbook that she took to the Amazon jungle eons ago, to get her through the rest of the semester.Daughter returns home midyear, we pay for logic board repairs, and off daughter goes again, this time to study in Turkey. Within 2 months of arriving in Istanbul, her MBP is showing the gray screen with the ? and all you Apple users know what THAT means. We tell her, take it to the Apple store.  She says, what Apple store? There is NO Apple store in Turkey! So she takes it to an "Apple authorized service center" but they won't work on it, they say it might be a hardware problem, and besides, Apple is opening a store soon, take it to their Genius Bar.So in the meantime I am once again Fedexing yes, you guessed it, the trusty, banged up, dented, scratched 5 yr old Samsung netbook to Istanbul.  While the $1500 MBP w/FCP sits, a cool, cold, and beautiful reminder of a bad relationship, awaiting it's fateful appointment (3 weeks away) with the Genius who will nicely inform my daughter that she will have to pay several hundred dollars if she wants her MBP working again.And surprise! Now my daughter discovers that none of her peers are using FCP X because it is too costly, too restrictive, too difficult to learn, and they are going back to PCs and using  Avid and Adobe!In a few months my daughter has an assignment to North Africa. She is taking the old Samsung netbook with her, and leaving the Macbook Pro (as she says, selling for parts) behind in Istanbul.If you are the type of urbanite who has access to an Apple store and/or can call Apple care toll free, maybe a MBP is for you.  But if you are an international road warrior, God help you, because Apple won't.

Reviews.Title: Rotten Apple! (Update October 2013)
Reviews.Author: Starfishin "Starfishin"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:Two weeks shy of 1 year -- and thus almost out of warranty -- the logic board blew again. Counting the one this came with, this was the fourth to go down. Apple finally threw in the towel, and replaced the unit.  While I appreciate this, it is something that should have been done after the first replacement failed. Apple's failure to respond appropriately cost me not only time, but a significant amount of money lost when commitments couldn't be met (backing-up work means little, I've found, when you don't have a place to recover it to. Repair turnaround on this laptop averaged a week or more.) As I see it, Apple had an identified problem (witness similar complaints across the web) and their delay in acknowledging that this problem was not "fixable" was not just inconsiderate, it was irresponsible. Apple is allegedly a premium brand -- and yet they offer not only a product with quality control issues, but just-fell-off-the-back-of-a-truck customer service.Original Review: Just had the second motherboard replacement -- and this laptop is not even a year old! Also had one power cord replacement, one track pad replacement, USB port replacement...you name it, it's blown. "Genius" (sic) techs also screwed up my data recovery -- all but the most recent hour had been backed up, but I needed it -- we tried to attached the external disk drive before they sent it in, but somehow they crossed a couple of wires and fried everything. I had to pay an outside company, recommended by the Geniuses, to do data recovery. Said company explained it was not unusual for the Geniuses to screw up in this way.Searching the web, I see a lot of people have similar/identical problems with this model.Obviously, I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.However, if you want to take the risk, here are a few observations:I sent for the 13.3-inch, which in retrospect is a little tight. I probably would have sized up.I'm not crazy about the OS. It's not nearly as intuitive as they claim. And as for all the fancy finger swipes -- I just gave up and attached a mouse.(I have been a Mac desktop user for well more than 20 years, and a sporadic Mac laptop user. Right now I'm typing this on a five year old Gateway -- it ain't a Mac...but then Macs aren't Macs anymore, either.)

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: UpNortGuy
Reviews.Content: Stopped turning on after 54 weeks. Very disappointed with Apple. This was our fourth Apple computer and it seems like  the problems started developing sooner with each one.

Reviews.Title: Its a keeper
Reviews.Author: Courtney Kissinger
Reviews.Content: I have had many many different laptops, and this is the only one I don't want to replace. I recently tried a Lenovo, thought maybe I'd give up on Mac and go with Win8 touchscreen, but I returned it. Instead I installed Windows 8 on my MacBook Air, and now I use it as my work machine, fantastic for traveling.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop, bad price
Reviews.Author: MasterReviewer05
Reviews.Content: This laptop is amazing! You can do absolutely anything and is very fast and stylish. Apple has created a laptop that will never be forgotten. But as I said, this is probably the most expensive laptop I've ever seen for not a big size. If you have a lot of money that you are waiting to buy something you have to buy this. This laptop is amazing but only buy it if you can afford it. I highly recommend this laptop for the style and quality but not for the price.

Reviews.Title: Defected
Reviews.Author: Trey Franks
Reviews.Content: This computer came defected. My wife was so excited to open the box, but quickly came to see that it did not function as it should. The mouse moves erratically, clicks randomly and my wife is extremely frustrated that she cannot do her work. We are taking it in to get fixed, but are still so disappointed to have spent the money we did on this product only for it to come defected.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy with my first MacBook Pro!
Reviews.Author: Raymond Goitia
Reviews.Content: I have had my MacBook Pro for almost a month and I am very happy and satisfied with it. Everything is so easy and intuitive to setup or configure. I have had the best experience ever with importing and editing videos and pictures. Email and Internet browsing is a breeze. Don't get me wrong, not everything is perfect. Having heard from friends and family about how reliable a Mac product is, I never expected to have an application crash within the first month, but I did. However, the experience was great since the OS does not become unstable and the application will simply shutdown and reopen.I highly recommend the MacBook Pro to anyone who wants a product that is stable, intuitive, easy and fun!

Reviews.Title: MacBook Pro 13.3"
Reviews.Author: Tyler M.
Reviews.Content: This is my very first Mac and I made the switch from years of using Windows. I had been wanting a MacBook for three years before I actually had enough money to purchase one. I am a college freshman and I bought my MacBook Pro mainly for school and so far I am loving it! The screen is nice and very clean. The downside to the screen, however, is you can't see in direct sunlight (which is a problem for someone like me who likes to sit outside and do work on the plaza at my school) and it is a magnet for dust and lint. The laptop is very lightweight and portable; I rarely even notice it's in my backpack! The keys are very well lit and comfortable to type on and you don't hear the annoying click-clack that most keyboards make (a plus for someone like me who enjoys the quiet). The sound is nice and loud; I don't have any problems with hearing anything. One of my favorite things about it is that you can't hear it running. I've had this laptop for only a week now but I've had it running pretty hard with all apps open and it'll just get hot, but you can't hear the fan or computer running. This is perfect for when I'm in class taking notes because I don't get distracted or annoy others by the computer being loud and disruptive. I only have two complaints: 1) the laptop heats up pretty fast but it doesn't burn your leg or anything and 2) the battery indicator is very indecisive, meaning that the "Calculated Time Remaining..." isn't too accurate and it'll show only 4 hours left after I've completed a full charge and have my keyboard lights off and my screen at half brightness. Despite the battery life indicator, the laptop (at half screen brightness and half or less keyboard brightness) gets well over 8 hours of battery life, as advertised by Apple, which is PERFECT for me. I don't think a Mac is worth the $1000 but I do not regret spending it on this laptop one bit! Thank you, Apple, for creating a computer I can actually deal with!

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Brrr in Colorado
Reviews.Content: Like it. It did everything we expected! The seller did not provide tracking number which was weird, but the Mac Pro was in good shape upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: Best laptop I have owned
Reviews.Author: Mr. Retro
Reviews.Content: Build quality is awesome, value is higher than any other laptop.  I run Windows 7 on this better than any other laptop I have owned.  A bit on the heavy side, but a small price to pay for what you get.

Reviews.Title: #1 Laptop
Reviews.Author: Jorge Raygoza
Reviews.Content: I've recently bought this laptop & I believe it's one of the best in the market. It runs pretty fast with it's new intel processors.Also, it has a great display.

Reviews.Title: I own
Reviews.Author: Li Li
Reviews.Content: I have this laptop and it's easy to use very. I take it with me to school and work, and anytime I need it. It was expensive, very! But it was so worth the money. And it's looks, beautiful. I always get compliments.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: kateitsme
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS COMPUTER. I was hesitant because it was a lot of money but I'm absolutely in love with it. Worth every penny! I'm a college student so I use my computer a lot, I already am hooked and have no intentions of ever going back to PC.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: somnath
Reviews.Content: Mac , ohh my god. it is awesome to use such laptop. got in 999$ from amazon.. Feeling lucky to use such powerful laptop.

Reviews.Title: Once you go Mac, you don't go back
Reviews.Author: Corey S.
Reviews.Content: The Macbook Pro is simply a great machine. Since I got mine last year I have not even touched my windows machine. The Pro is a great any purpose computer, which makes it a good choice for just about anybody even simple users. It is also one of the few machines that still does a cd drive in the device. So for music enthusiasts, this is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Great product, great support!
Reviews.Author: Bryan Harris
Reviews.Content: The computer has worked flawlessly and the seller has done a great job of going above and beyond to answer questions and help me get the software configured.

Reviews.Title: Another great Mac
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: I've been using Apple's since 1992 and this is the fastest and best one I'vehad. I wanted an i7 chip and I wanted one I could still work on. The Retinaldisplay laptops don't allow for much tinkering. I wanted to be able to addmy own memory, add a second hard drive, and in the future replace thebattery when it begins to fail. This Mac allows all of that. I don't game a lotso I don't need a super HD display; for that I use my AppleTV to display onmy 52" TV.This is very fast, high performance computer. This should be more thanenough computer for almost everyone. I would not hesitate recommendingthis to anyone.It fast and easy to set up. I had cloned my data from my old computer usingCarbon Copy Cloner (CCC) and simply moved everything to the new computerand was off and running at speeds I had only dreamed up before.

Reviews.Title: It's a Mac.
Reviews.Author: FrontPage
Reviews.Content: I've been spoiled by the build quality and stability of Macintosh and even this used computer is a gem. I can bat around all the things that everyone else says, but it's been what we've been using for decades and I have nothing bad to say. It churns out HD content, runs without many flaws and I've yet to get a virus on a Mac since I started using the platform in the early 1990's.My 15" MacBook's motherboard fried but I think that was a sugar spill that I never bothered cleaning up. Oops. That's the only issue I've ever had since working on Macs in 1995. That's a pretty impressive track record don't you think?

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: His Wife
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend actually bought it to record and he loves it. It meet all of his expectations and it was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Another Apple Success!!
Reviews.Author: heather
Reviews.Content: More and more I am falling in love with Apple products!  I bought this for my daughter sweet 16 bday and she loves it!  Very satisfied and will continue purchasing apple products for sure!  Now to buy the office/student word software!

Reviews.Title: Best laptop
Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn Marie Valladares
Reviews.Content: After buy a mac I won't use another brand. Its sleek, pretty, and fast. It's a bit heavy and the cover and get grubby but all laptops require a basic cleaning every once in awhile. So far so good

Reviews.Title: I love my Mac!
Reviews.Author: melanie
Reviews.Content: It was exactly what I wanted, in great condition. Absolutely perfect.  Super fast, lots of memory and it looks nice

Reviews.Title: liked it, but i wish it would have come with a clean load of OSX
Reviews.Author: Zachary
Reviews.Content: The Mac itself was in overall good shape. However, I did have to do some leg work getting the hard drive cleared of previous users data. I would have much preferred to get it with a new, clean load of OS X.

Reviews.Title: Love it great computer
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with a macbook pro excellent product can't recommend enough. A wonderful base computer perfect for work or school with enough storage to most anything.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Judith Dishinger
Reviews.Content: Just what I wanted.  Will not go back to a PC after using this apple Mac Pro.  Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great customer service!
Reviews.Author: Connolly Riley
Reviews.Content: These guys are great! Absolutely nothing but nice people and just willing to satisfy the customer! Took care of everything and made it easy as pie for me!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: mohamed
Reviews.Content: Very high quality product . I did not find any proplem with it. Long life battery . High performance . You will like to buy it . Or it's higher versions

Reviews.Title: Bought for my Daughter
Reviews.Author: sharring09
Reviews.Content: My daughter insisted I get this for her while she attends college.  She is still using it a year later and it seems to be in good condition and she loves using it.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Elijah Peterson
Reviews.Content: The computer worked great!! It is everything I was looking for. It has some really cool features. Definitely top of the line.

Reviews.Title: Very good operating system and quick
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: My fisrt Apple computer did not disappoint.  I am not techy,but for the most did not need to be one to use it.  My only complaint is that the initial load came with no insturctions, the start-up steps are not intuitive and it is the least streamlined part of the Mac experience.  Surprising from Apple.  However, once past that process you will find the rest easy and fun.  Learn to sue the command key, it is very useful over several of the software programs that come with the hardware.

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly, in great condition!
Reviews.Author: Ed M
Reviews.Content: No complaints here. Arrived in great condition and perfect working order. It was advertised as "Used" but it looks and feels brand new. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Stephen W. Riley
Reviews.Content: There is nothing to beat Apple, but it would be even better if it would accept programs from other developers more easily!

Reviews.Title: Never go back
Reviews.Author: James "James"
Reviews.Content: I used to buy a new laptop every three years and spend about $600-800 each time. My friend convinced me to get the iMac and I am very happy with my purchase. I paid about twice what I usually pay for a laptop but I can tell thus will last me over seven years. It takes a bit getting used to coming from a pc, but it is well worth it. Ask anyone who has a iMac, they will never go back to pc again.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: carlos
Reviews.Content: Go computer no problems at all and i never have a macbook pro before and now i am in loved with this computer i am a dj and this computer is great for deejaying great i make a great decision

Reviews.Title: Excellent shape outside--inside required servicing
Reviews.Author: BobW "Robert Webster"
Reviews.Content: The MacBook is just what I wanted, fast, ample memory, OSX Maverick, like-new condition,and delivered on time.The only problem encountered was that it had not been wiped clean of all programs from the formerowner.  This caused big problems with my passwords and attempts to install my programs.  Had totake it to an Apple store locally for service before I could really call it "mine".

Reviews.Title: MBPro 13, A-1278, MD102LL/A, 750GB HDD, i7, 8GB RAM
Reviews.Author: Thomas Bangash "THBangash"
Reviews.Content: It may say to be the OLD Version, as the so-called Newer Version is available, thou that is not the true statement, as the Newer is not with the same configuration, not even close.The primary reason for me wanting this rather Former Model instead of the NEW Model (Retina) was the Configuration itself, and the UPGRADABILITY of it, which is almost NON Exsistant in the Retina Models.After decades of Pure PC usage, it does take a bit time to get use to the new OS and the way things work in this one compare to Windows, but that sort of applies to every change over.The integration of the system on my domestic set-up, consisting of almost purely Apple Products, from router to Systems, and Peripheral iOS units like the IPads, IPhones and IPods, went smoothly,

Reviews.Title: Great deal 4 me, but sloooow delivery
Reviews.Author: Doctor Plenty
Reviews.Content: The non-Amazon dealer (Hustle Double*, I believe) was absolutely great.  I would absolutely recommend him (I think) as a 2nd party seller.  Very trustworthy.  Except my package was not sent off on date promised.  But in the long view, for what I got, that was relatively minor once the computer did arrive (about five days later than I expected)  I'm typing this on my almost MacBook Pro right now!!*don't be put off by the name, it's a baseball reference

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: DJ IIJIMA
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my granddaughter she just loves it. we went through many different brands of laptops and was notsatisfied with it, but the Apple Mac is wonderful. I am thinking of getting another soon. definitely will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Another Gift
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my niece and she uses it all the time.  Could not be more happy just loves her MAC

Reviews.Title: Superb Computer
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I purchased this MacBook Pro after 20 years of tolerating the endless code corruption, blue screens, and viruses that come with all Windows based PCs. With just over four months of use, I can say this is a superb computer. It operates perfectly and quickly, and the integration across my iPhone and iPad is seamless. I chose this unit over the Retina screen version to get the onboard DVD drive and ethernet receptacle. I can set this MacBook Pro next to my wife's new MacBook Pro Retina 15" screen and it is very hard to tell the difference in quality. If I were doing photo editing or other graphics intensive applications I might view it differently. I just did the free operating system upgrade to Mavericks and it was very easy and also operates perfectly. I'm pleased that even with the new MacBook Pro line introduced in late 2013, Apple is keeping this 13" non-Retina screen computer in its lineup.

Reviews.Title: Bought for Senior's Computer Club Use
Reviews.Author: Kona Mike
Reviews.Content: Bought  for teaching Apple computers to senior's computer club. Unit was purchased as refurb. [Club has to watch its budget].Will be used to demonstrate inter-connectivity between Iphone Ipad and Apple computers. Also to demonstrate various Apple programs as well a dual boot capability with either Windows 7 or 8 OS. So far this product has exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: The only way to go..
Reviews.Author: Ryan Coody
Reviews.Content: I love this MacBook. I'm using it right now to share this review. Works great, fast enough. I upgraded the RAM just because I edit a lot of photos and that eats up memory and slows it down, but for normal everyday email/internet/word processing you'll have no trouble. I'm not going to detail all the pros and cons of Mac vs. Windows as that's pretty well covered out there already, but as far as MacBook's go, this one is a winner. I have owned MacBook Pro's in the past and this is by far the lightest and most powerful yet - not quite as thin as a MacBook Air but much more useful.

Reviews.Title: Mac Book Pro is amazing
Reviews.Author: Juan Rodriguez Fernandez
Reviews.Content: I like everything about my new Mac Book. Is fast a reliable, and I'm so happy I went with the 13 inch without retina display and invested in more powerful processor.

Reviews.Title: MacBook Pro 13.3 Inch Review
Reviews.Author: Tolu Omole
Reviews.Content: I recently was fortunate enough to receive a 13.3 inch Mac Laptop as a christmas present last year. I am pleased to report that it is one of the best presents I have received to date. I had been wanting alaptop for a long time. In my home we have a desktop computer in the family room. This is where I would do all of my homework, but because of my other family members this became more and more strenuous. My mac laptop fixed this issue.  This laptop is a fine device, it is very sleek and modern. I actually enjoy using this laptop whenever I open it. The screen resolution is crisp and clear.  The 13 inch width of the screen works great for me. The screen doesn't feel to big but at the same time It still doesn't feel too small.  I have never used a mac before, and I was scared that my steep learning curve would be a major issue. But i was pleasantly surprised to find out that I was wrong. Much of the user interface on the mac is pretty intuitive. Also when their is something that a user does not know but needs to find out, google is a quick and easy way to find this knowledge.  Mac's also seem to be quite durable! i have dropped mine a couple times with only a slim plastic case covering it. Yet my mac continues to function properly. Also I have spilled water on it once or twice and my mac still continues to work perfectly.  I would recommend buying this mac to anyone who is looking for a sleek and trendy personal computer, that is also functional and durableThe cost is a bit high but worth it in my opinion. I doubt anyone will be disappointed after purchasing this product.

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: kevin webb
Reviews.Content: This is truly my wife favorite gift that I have every bought. She uses her Macbook for Everything. She loves it great hardware and software.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Laptop.
Reviews.Author: T. HALASNIK
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Laptop, way better then any windows laptop I ever used. Apple hit a home run here. Very satisfied with this machine.

Reviews.Title: Like & Dislikes
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: Nice Display  Fast Operation  I Photo could be easier to use  Overall a nice machine & I would recommend to my friendsalthough Price is an issue It costs too much !

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Gerald R. Sparrow "Gerald"
Reviews.Content: Came right on time and this is my first Mac. Still learning how to use it after so many years with windows. Now I don't want to go back. This was a very good choice and I love it!

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong with Apple!
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: Yes the prices are always a little higher for Apple products, but there is no other interface I'd pay a premium for except the OSX and iOS.15inch looks so much better than the 13in.

Reviews.Title: Pleased so far
Reviews.Author: Gabe
Reviews.Content: I first purchased a Sony Viao fit 14 touchscreen with 850 GB because my old Dell crapped out. Did not enjoy the new Windows 8 and touchscreen functions. Decided to spend a couple more bucks and purchase my self this Macbook Pro. What a beauty of machinery, super fast,quiet and does its job.Cant really say much just had this laptop for less than a week but so far im very pleased!Will deff take care of this machine,deff worth the money!Just research yourself tips on how to give it proper care  and you should be fine!

Reviews.Title: I Love It !!!!
Reviews.Author: cora2020
Reviews.Content: It's been a long time that I wanted to own a MacBook Pro.  When my Dell laptop gave up only after 2 1/2 years, I decided to buy MacBook Pro.  I've heard so many positive feedbacks from my friends who already own a MacBook Pro, so i feel very comfortable that this investment will last a lot longer than a regular PC.

Reviews.Title: MOVE TO APPLE LIKE I DID!
Reviews.Author: Gerald A. Pelrine "some guy"
Reviews.Content: i'VE BEEN WANTING TO SWITCH FROM PCs TO MACS FOR YEARS. i FINALLY DID IT AND THIS MACHINE IS THE WAY TO GO! There is definitely a learning curve but its not too bad; just give yourself a couple of days and you'll never look back. Don't let the smaller screen throw you off, you'll see it just fine.

Reviews.Title: My MacBook
Reviews.Author: Elias Vaden
Reviews.Content: I love my MacBook. So much. Amazon was just the most helpful too. I would recommend anyone wanting to buy a MacBook to do so from Amazon. They have the best prices, they are fast, and completely reliable. 10/10 five stars would recommend.

Reviews.Title: excellent product
Reviews.Author: brayd
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and learn. Quick and has built in virus control. Links with IPHONE.  Size is perfect. Would definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: Top Competitor
Reviews.Author: Daniel H.
Reviews.Content: I have had the MacBook Pro for about 3 years and I have never had any problems with its performance. I like the design and its features but there are somethings I think needs to be improved. I believe that the Newer Pros should have Microsoft office installed as most buyers of this product are students. The HDMI Port could be introduced instead of having customers buy a connection piece which is hard to find, I picked up mine when I was in Japan while in the military at an Apple Store. There is no way you can find the necessary port in a Wal-Mart or Bestbuy and I have Checked.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the money
Reviews.Author: Lonnie C Turner
Reviews.Content: I know that Apple makes bigger and faster laptops, some with more memory, but for the price this is a great little laptop.

Reviews.Title: Good Purchase
Reviews.Author: Humberto
Reviews.Content: For us, this laptop is the best option because is light, the battery have 5 hours. The price is 200 dollars down.

Reviews.Title: GOOD ，I LIKE It VERY MUCH！IT HAD GIVEN Me A LOT OF FUN,I'LL RECOMEND IT TO MY FRIENDS!NICE NICE GREAT
Reviews.Author: sean
Reviews.Content: GOOD ，I LIKE It VERY MUCH！IT HAD GIVEN Me A LOT OF FUN,I'LL RECOMEND IT TO MY FRIENDS!NICE NICE GREAT

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: mauro fragachan
Reviews.Content: I got my new mac and I have to say that it is amazing. everything worked out really well with amazon, so I recommend you to buy it through them

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase
Reviews.Author: Krystal D. Watson "Kwatson"
Reviews.Content: The item received was exactly as identified.  Also, there was a negative experience that was quickly transformed into a positive experience. The item was to originally be received by a specific date; however, due to the items being damaged in transit, Amazon promptly contacted me and notified of its status and immediately re-shipped a new item at no additional cost, which was received on time.
