Reviews.Content: I like the 13 inch macbooks. Its size is ideal and the weight is acceptable. The new Mac OS Mountain Lion has some nice features as wel as the trackpad. I didn't think i would need an optical drive but since i have had it I used it several times. Installed Parallels 8 on it and windows 7 and windows 8 actually works excellent (should i provoke some people and say that i find it works better than the Mac OS). The magnetic lid and charger is cool and battery indicator on the side is cool. Used my IR remote with it and was kinda glad i didn't buy the retina display or the air.

Reviews.Title: Apple MacBook Pro MD102LL/A 13.3-Inch Laptop
Reviews.Author: Jaime Muñoz
Reviews.Content: Of course I'm happy with this purchase. It has justified all my expectations.I think that was a great decision to buy

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CHOICE!!!
Reviews.Author: charles
Reviews.Content: Bought this on sale and I'm glad i did. Already owning a iMac desktop, this Macbook Pro is amazing!! Love the migration between the 2 computers. Amazon did a great job keeping me informed throughout the shipping process. Don't hesitate buying this pro.

Reviews.Title: Awesome computer
Reviews.Author: Dean
Reviews.Content: Bought this computer then added on 16GB owc ram and 240 gig owc mercury extreme pro ssd drive.The ram and ssd turn this laptop into a very fast machine.Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: World Nomad "Rich"
Reviews.Content: This is my first Apple laptop, finally!!! I bought it here on Amazon, since the price was substantially better than anywhere else;) I got the base model, as I wanted to upgrade it myself after the purchase. My current configuration has 16GB RAM and 256GB+512GB SSDs inside. It boots up in 7-8 seconds, rather than 42 secs as in the base configuration when I got it. Can't complain;)I got used to the OS X fairly easily, absolutely love the trackpad and gestures, the single best feature to me!!! I also installed a version of Win7 through Parallels Desktop 8, just in case, but use it only sporadically, if at all... Mine main uses are just basic browsing, downloading, watching movies, tv shows, listening to music, syncing my iPad and iPhone and light photography apps: Lightroom 4.2, Aperture. For this, i5 dual core CPU is fine, didn't see a need to spend extra for i7 and 15.4". I really wanted only 13.3" laptop (I upgraded from Dell XPS M1330) and that's more than enough for me as I also have an external 24" IPS LCD NEC monitor. So far, I love it!!! Go get one, too;)

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Bih13
Reviews.Content: This is the first time i ever bought anything Apple related, so i was kind of skeptical, but i love it! Its fast, easy to use and it looks great. I love the hand motions you use to complete actions, it just makes things so much easier. I take it to work, and because it's super light, its hardly a hassle. I will definitely be getting another one after this one gets old. This was  a great investment!

Reviews.Title: Buy It
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to take the plunge and go from a PC to a Mac. I was thinking "it's so expensive" "I could buy two PCs for the price of one Mac". I wish I would have taken the plunge years ago. This computer is so quick, easy to use, and so much better than any PC I have had. If you can afford it, buy it. I know you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Apple Nuffield said
Reviews.Author: Photobug
Reviews.Content: I love love love this computer. I'm an apple guy so I have iPhone iPad I shuffle G4 G5. So I know how the systems work. I will always buy apple!!! Love em

Reviews.Title: Great Machine! Worth it!
Reviews.Author: S. Sahni
Reviews.Content: I love this little guy. It's fast, light, and simple to use. Highly recommended for the college kid or anyone else looking for a great computer.

Reviews.Title: Arrived as Advertised
Reviews.Author: L. Adler
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Macbook for my daughter's birthday.  I saved about $100 plus tax ordering on Amazon and since I have prime, it arrived overnight for just $3.99 more.  Great job Amazon.  You save me lots of money from the standard brick and morter stores.

Reviews.Title: Apple MacBook Pro MD103LL/A 15.4-Inch
Reviews.Author: NaturalNotSyntheticSupplements
Reviews.Content: I waited a week to write this glowing review because I wanted to make sure the MacBook Pro was great.  It is!  I was able to make an informed decision to make the purchase because of the complete details provided in the product review. Of course the laptop is for my daughter whose original laptop was stolen so I was not excited about the prospect of purchasing a replacement.  This particular purchase was an exceptionally good choice for the MacBook MD103LL/A runs cooler than my daughter's previous MacBook Pro.  I will have to investigate the limited warranty advertised good through Sept 2013.  It is not an easy decision to purchase a used or even good as new laptop but I am very satisfied. The new MacBook Pro MD103LL/A runs cooler than her previous MacBook MC371LL/A 15.4 purchased in May 2010.

Reviews.Title: The best laptop out there!
Reviews.Author: Kacper244
Reviews.Content: I basically love this Macbook Pro. I had a 2011 iMac 21.5-inch before and sold it to get this laptop. I didn't make a mistake selling my iMac, this is even better than the iMac was. I ordred it at 6:00PM and I got it at 10:00AM next day. It is the best purchase I made this year. I be purchasing a separate monitor to connect this Macbook Pro to through, the screen is a bit small.

Reviews.Title: Quality device
Reviews.Author: Zohan
Reviews.Content: This device has met my expectations and I'm sure it will meet yours. So if yu want this laptop then yu will be

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE WITH AMAZON :)
Reviews.Author: Gwen Monaco
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed with the first Macbook Pro I received. I tried several times towork with Apple to resolve the issues the Mac was having after finally giving up with Apple myson suggested going back to Amazon to replace the defective one I received.I can tell you I will ALWAYS PURCHASE MY COMPUTERS THRU AMAZON!! Theywe so easy to work with and replaced my laptop within 2 days!I was shocked at the service Amazon provided compared to Apple.I love Amazon and would recommend to purchase any and all your online itemsthrough AMAZON! ~

Reviews.Title: Got A Mac ... Won't Look Back!
Reviews.Author: Bookaholic "prussblue"
Reviews.Content: I confess to having obtained the MacBook Pro in an Apple Store.  For personal reasons, I needed hands on.  One reason that I can share is that I had been an MS user for years ... and put up with the many frustrations associated with MS.  The latest frustration was having a certain brand of laptop, a gift, that was less than two years old suddenly go black screen, only the power light lit and then 7 beeps, a short interval, and more of the 7 beeps (I thought I was in a vehicle backing up).  I took it to the store.  They didn't even open it up but looked up the beep code which says that it is a processor failure.  They handed it back to me and said that it would cost more to repair than to replace ... PERIOD (and more to retrieve any data).  I then found that in a matter of a few weeks since the new OS came out that there were just a few machines left with Windows 7, some being the last item on the shelf.  I was given a demonstration of Windows 8.  I nearly had a 'melt down.' It was overwhelming!!!  If you have any handicap, i.e. visual, it is worse.  But, that's just my opinion.  BTW, I checked online regarding the old laptop that 'died' and found that I was not alone, far from it.  I found a number of people with the same laptop a year to less than two years old that had the same sudden failure.  Some had replaced the processor without any change.  I was told that it seems to be a multi - component failure.  One upset person said that the company knew of the problem and was doing nothing about it.  I won't say which brand but I was not going to be a ding dong and go back to more grief and certainly not put up with Windows 8.  The advertisements are great ... but I did not find the reality good for me.  I never used a Mac before.  But, when I got it home, I looked at a few videos online and was using it without much difficulty in a short time.  Hooking up to my WiFi and wireless all-in-one printer was almost like talking to the Mac and telling it to hook up by itself.  What would have been a 'grand process' with a device using MS was a breeze for me on the Mac, the guy who never used a Mac before. I'm happy!

Reviews.Title: Once you go Mac, you'll never go back.
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: To a prospective buyer,  08/10/2012Once you go Mac, you'll never go back. My wife and I decided to get a Mac desktop several years ago. Was the best decision we ever made. It runs just as fast as the day we got it with no problems! We don't have to de-frag, deliete cookies, run security programs, or any of the common PC problems that have to be delt with in order to keep you running and up to speed. You can't get a virus on Mac, so in the long run the cost of the Mac is saved by not buying security, and not having to replace your computer every year or two. We have had our desktop for around four years. My wife has had her Macbook pro going on three years, and I just purchaced My Macbook pro this year. Never had any issues, no frustrations just great easy wireless, all in one fun!

Reviews.Title: The Best Laptop
Reviews.Author: Dave Perkes
Reviews.Content: Solid build quality; stunning good looks,excellent performance,good battery life; I could not ask for more of a notebook.  I could not find any PC based notebooks that would compare with it without spending even more.A veryimportant feature is Firewire 800 which in my experience works better then USB3 (in PC enabled with USB3)I was not originally sold on the MAC OS I felt it was inferior in many ways To Windows 7.I had dual boot with Windows parallels; but the performance on windows was poor, so dot use that any more . Now that I have upgraded to Lion I am much happier about MAC OS and have just bought an iMac for office. it all integrates well.I do find the Macbook heavy for travel and I am not enthusiastic about the gloss screen.I recently upgraded to 8GB Ram and the performance is even faster on intensive graphics work.

Reviews.Title: Pretty cool
Reviews.Author: B
Reviews.Content: This is my first mac, and although it's pretty cool being the newest version June 2012, it kinda crawls along compared to the new macbook air with the solid state hard drive.I ordered an ssd for my new mac and an upgrade to 8gb of 1600Mhz Ram.  That should make this computer worthy of 5 stars.The ssd and extra ram are an option if you order directly from apple, but your definitely going to pay for it.  I think it was around 16 hundred bucks last I checked.  (It never hurts to check your options).If you ask me for almost $1200.00 an ssd and at least 8gb ram should have been included, but whatever, everybody wants more $$$.Overall I'm happy, but I'll definitely be happier when I upgrade to the ssd and more ram.  It's a solid laptop, and the aluminum body at least makes you feel like you've got something for your money as opposed to a plastic shell.  And I don't feel like I'm going to snap it in half on accident like the macbook air.I'm also thinking of taking out the optical drive while I'm putting in the new ssd.  I watched some video's it's not rocket science so if your comfortable with electronics you shouldn't have a problem.  This should make it a little lighter, but may void your warrenty (but not forever apparently).  If you need to get it serviced the guys at apple just told me to pop back in the optical drive before I get it serviced.  They definitely have good customer service, so that is always a plus.They said changing the ssd and ram doesn't affect the warranty at all so if your sketchy about removing the optical drive you can at least upgrade to the ssd and upgrade the ram and not affect your warranty.  Hope this helps if you have been looking at macs for a while like I was.  Read other reviews, but more importantly actually visit an apple store and play with the different laptops if you can.  That will help you decide more than anything.  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: terrible...returned it
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: NB, I probably got a lemon (that's what my friends say, at least).  I bought this MacBook Pro to replace my six-year-old PC (a Sony Vaio), but it was basically no better than my old PC, so I returned it.  Big problems: it took 36 seconds to open Microsoft Word.  Why on earth would a brand new computer take that long?  It dropped the wireless connection incessantly (no, it wasn't the internet's fault, because my iPad and my Vaio both could hold the connection from the exact same place in the house). The computer woke up from sleep pretty quickly, but it took at least 60 seconds to boot.  So, I returned it, and instead I got an Acer Aspire, which I love (it's 2.5lbs, i7, 256GB SSD, and it was $950--to get a MacBook Air like that, it would cost $1700).

Reviews.Title: Black screen - I don't know what to do
Reviews.Author: Simone Mariote
Reviews.Content: I bought my first MacBook exactly 5 months ago and was really happy with my new toy, but what was not my surprise when I turned it on 2 days ago and the screen was completely black. I can hear the noise of the computer turning on and the lights also turn on but the screen in completely dead. As I live in Brazil I don't know if is there any local guarantee for my computer. Anyone had the same problem? Any suggestion for a solution?

Reviews.Title: Once you go Mac you won't go back!
Reviews.Author: Chris Waechter
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good about Macbook Pro's or even Mac computers as a whole. This laptop was purchased for a 14 yr old daughter, works great.

Reviews.Title: The best investment!
Reviews.Author: Pedro San Miguel
Reviews.Content: Although the team came to me packed and sealed in its original packaging, I had a problem that required him to the authorized service center in my country Mac.Despite the drawbacks the computer works great, it's the best investment I have made.

Reviews.Title: Lifetime Windows user switched to a Mac, never going back (except for games)
Reviews.Author: D. Harry
Reviews.Content: So long story short I have been using PC's since the days of DOS. Stuck around with PC's till Windows 8.1, which was my last machine. I started looking at Macs because I was tired of dealing with spyware/adware, and I am an extremely careful user, it isn't like I go download warez. Also networking PC's together for an amateur got difficult a lot of the time. So I decided to switch and I sold my Lenovo Yoga 2 Pro and bought a 13" Macbook Pro.I should have switched a long time ago.It seems like everything in the Apple ecosystem is designed around what is easier for the user, what is more convenient, rather than the Windows approach which is to force a particular method of operation on you.My observations:Magsafe magnetic power cord. Pure genius. I have damaged several laptop jacks over the years because of either myself tripping over power cords, or people tripping over power cords. It might sound crazy, but the MagSafe power cod was my main reason for going to Mac. I am not sure when the patent will run out and PC's can get it, but it works flawlessly.Glass trackpad: Simply the best in the industry. Many companies have tried to duplicate it and they have all failed IMO. The trackpad on my last machine was horrible. Apple has it down with the many gestures, they all work flawlessly.Design: Solid aluminum, this is built like a tank.OS:X. Well I love it. Blows Windows 8.1 out of the water.The only downsides about Apple products is the price. But you do get what you pay for. PC's are way cheaper, but if you have a problem with your computer you can't go online, make an appointment and talk with someone. The Genius bar is awesome. Sometimes you get free advice sometimes they charge you.

Reviews.Title: It's everything I wanted in a smaller lap top!
Reviews.Author: Tann
Reviews.Content: I wanted the newer version of the mac book pro that I had had (with no problems except age 8 yrs) so I decided to go with the mac book pro but this time more memory and a smaller size (13) instead of 17.  I also chose the hard drive because I wasn't ready to go to solid state or the mac book air where I couldn't upgrade...It's so nice that the battery last so long and that this machine has the snow lion and everything on my ipad and iPhone iCloud it over to each other!  The perfect match for me and I can still with one machine watch a cd (with out adding a part) and I have 8 GB and I'm thrilled about that!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!
Reviews.Author: S. Luna "ladyjack"
Reviews.Content: We love this computer! Even though we are primarily a PC family, we have not been disappointed at all. We will likely buy another MacBook soon.

Reviews.Title: Loving my Macbook
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel
Reviews.Content: First time apple user here, well, mac user and I must say the transition from PC to Mac for me was pretty simple. A lot of features and shortcuts on the MBP that I was never exposed to on a normal PC. I tend to wonder why I ever used Windows in the first place haha. Once you go Mac, you can't go back

Reviews.Title: Great size
Reviews.Author: pely
Reviews.Content: Love this computer. It is the perfect size and speed for me. I remmend it for everyday use at home or when traveling.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Laptop
Reviews.Author: christina anderson
Reviews.Content: I needed a laptop that I would not have to worry about system crashes and freezing up and other glitches that seem to always be happening on my friends laptops.  After discussing this with many friends and colleagues I came to realize that anyone who was completely satisfied with their laptop owned a MacBook!  And now I am a proud MacBook owner also!

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: shervin shayegan
Reviews.Content: I have both mac and desktop! working with Mac is so much easier, so many cool features. was debating to buy one for months, checked out different stuff on youtube, and read different articles and debates,I just didnt really wanna spend the money but Im glad that I did. you will not regret it, promise you!

Reviews.Title: Best of both worlds (laptop/desktop)
Reviews.Author: HelloKata
Reviews.Content: After limping along for a couple of years, I retired the old Mac Mini and MacBook to keep up with new software. Realizing that I use the desktop computer most of the time but need a portable only on occasion, I chose the basic MacBook Pro. It operates in closed clamshell mode, so it's out of the way, and---unlike the MacBook Air---it has all the necessary ports to function as a desktop computer. It connects to all of my existing hardware: 19-in. LCD monitor (Mini DisplayPort-to-DVI adapter purchased separately); external storage device; printer/scanner; keyboard/mouse; speakers/headset. Since I use the laptop screen so infrequently, I passed on the additional expense of Retina Display.

Reviews.Title: Mac Book Pros
Reviews.Author: Allison Watt
Reviews.Content: Mac computers are the greatest! It's awesome knowing that I can sit down and do my homework online with no popups, no virus, and no distractions. I have had my computer for about four years now and never have had any problems with it. I loved it so much that I decided to get a Mac Book Pro, which is a laptop. Again, no popups or any type of distractions when I'm really trying to focus on line. My laptop is so light that I can take it with me anywhere. The battery life is amazing. I feel like I can be on it all day long without it being plugged into an outlet. It has a perfect size screen and many different USB plug ins so I can always have my phone charging or a hard drive plugged in. It allows me to download any apps that I might need for school or just to have for my personal life. I would recommend a Mac to anyone that is looking for a laptop.

Reviews.Title: Pick of the litter--the only practical remaining choice for some of us.
Reviews.Author: Samuel Chell
Reviews.Content: Apple Store's display doesn't make it especially easy to compare the most significant differences among models, but it appears that the 15" MacBook Pro (not the 15" MacBook Pro Retina) is the ONLY current Apple computer that comes with the following three features that are so essential to many us: 1. a built-in optical drive ("Superdrive"); 2. an "Audio In" port; 3. an "Audio Out" port.  With such a machine, any audiophile or media person is practically assured of having a self-contained portable audio workstation, one that will record LPs, cassette tapes, FM broadcasts with a simple line (in my case, from an Onkyo receiver) to the "Audio In" of the machine, nothing else required.  Moreover, the presence of the two ports permits near-flawless capturing of any of the sounds emitted from a website or from the computer by attaching a simple patch cord between the two ports (I use an inexpensive splitter at the "Audio Out" port for monitoring purposes.  Finally, the built-in optical drive obviates the need to drag along an external drive, which can prove clumsy at best (taking up extra space on the desk) and mal-functioning at worst (I've never had a problem with an internal SuperDrive, but the external Apple Drives have failed with astonishing regularity, requiring all sorts of ingenious tricks to remove a stuck CD and often suffering damage in the process of removal).By contrast with this machine, the new iMac (and most of the other Macbooks) offers neither an optical drive nor an "audio in" port. Moreover, with the lack of an internal optical drive, I've forfeited two of the machine's USB ports--one to an interface; the other, to a burner--while attempting, with sporadic success, to import decent audio into the computer.  (At least, I've learned to purchase only external optical drives that have an eject button and a slide-out tray.  None of the non-Apple optical drives has presented so much as a single problem--and each has cost me under $50).I was among the first to purchase the unloved, scorned-upon Macbook Air back in 2008.  The first model had some costly problems (that problematic hinge!), but Apple withstood the flak (especially about the absence of an optical drive) and by 2010 came to market with not one but two Macbook Airs--an 11" and  13".  The criticism has waned, and now I'd be the first to recommend an Air for truly portable computing.  Unfortunately, what was once regarded as an aberration, then a curiosity, and finally a respected member of the Apple family, has now, it would appear, become the "prototype" for all Apple models.  I would expect the machine you're looking at to be the last Apple machine to come with the 3 features mentioned above.This may be a transitional time in Apple's history, one leading, moreover, to another consumer computing revolution and to a roaring comeback in Apple's stock price.  If people increasingly find CDs useless--even in their music collections--and if makers of ancillary products begin to show more products that might benefit from the added speed of US 3.0 and Thunderbolt (which is close to being all that remains of Apple connectivity apart from "the Cloud"), Apple could win big--really big.  But in the meantime, consumers who purchase, for example, a new iMac can only be left scratching their heads about how to make use of all those super-fast ports (USB 3 and Thunderbolt) on the back of their new machines, however ahead of the curve they may be.  At this point, the iMac has become less about practicality than bragging rights ("look guys, mine has a Fusion Drive--just take my word for it").

Reviews.Title: Bought this to replace a 2006 Macbook Pro
Reviews.Author: Eric Chang
Reviews.Content: Had to replace my old Macbook Pro not due to defect, but was rather unexpectedly smashed to pieces from a fall.I enjoy the speedier processor and better battery life, although I think 7 hours is a bit optimistic.  I went with this instead of retina because I wanted an optical drive and suspect this body style might be a tad more upgradable.

Reviews.Title: It's a MacBook Pro!
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: Just got my Macbook Pro 15" and could not be happier. It's the mid 2012 version. Web surfuring is smooth and seamless.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: Great deal on an amazing lap top! not something you want to miss out on!!! It comes brand new out of the box and is fast, gorgeous and over all an amazing computer.

Reviews.Title: which MacBook pro are you reviewing??
Reviews.Author: islandgirl "fran"
Reviews.Content: The majority of the reviews seem to be for the 13.3 MacBook Pro  Model # MD101LL/A.Is the information interchangeable??I am only interested in the 15.4  McBook Pro  Model # MD103LL/A

Reviews.Title: He loved it!
Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: I got my husband this computed for Christmas and he absulutely loves it!  He's been talking about it for a month now.  Very to easy to learn.  We had been only PC users before this.  I don't know if we'll ever go back to a PC.  I know Apples are more expensive than PCs, but he thinks it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC!!!!!
Reviews.Author: PLUMMA
Reviews.Content: I've been p/c all my life but i decided to come over to the other side for once and I'LL NEVER GO BACK TO P/C EVER AGAIN, This mac is great out of the box but i got tempted to make it faster by upgrading memory and replacingHDD to a SSD, Holy crap its the fastest puter i have ever touched. 12.44 seconds to boot. Beat that!

Reviews.Title: Great laptop!
Reviews.Author: Meghan Burr
Reviews.Content: Best laptop I have ever owned! System is running great. No complaints BUT have since discovered better prices at Moween on refurbished Mac products.

Reviews.Title: Great as usual.
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Just upgraded to a 13" non-retina Mac Book Pro i7 from a mid 2009 core 2 duo. The machine is speedy and efficient. I'm not surprised, and I'm just delighted. I would strongly recommend a Mac any day over a PC without any doubt. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: It's really good ,i thought It's used ,but when i got it,it is really new,whatever i like it.even ox system not very good.

Reviews.Title: i love it!
Reviews.Author: jamie
Reviews.Content: i am so glad i finally bought one. i love the keyboard and the screen. i dont miss my old pc at all!!

Reviews.Title: Apple MacBook Pro
Reviews.Author: Daniel Ramirez "danramirez"
Reviews.Content: Es mi 3ra laptop y defininitavemente son las mejores a nivel mundial. Cada vez mejoran los detalles de fabricación. Excelente producto.

Reviews.Title: Apple MACBook Pro MD103LL/A 15.4-inch Laptop
Reviews.Author: Glen L. Beere
Reviews.Content: The new MacBook Pro is everything I expected it to be.  User friendly, fast and high tech  It is amazing!

Reviews.Title: laptop
Reviews.Author: J. Simone
Reviews.Content: excellent product.  a little heavy but very efficient and easy to use.  it takes a wile to change from many years in Windows to operative system.  but is possible

Reviews.Title: Macbook Pro MD101
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After 30 years of Microsoft, I've finally moved to Apple and now own iPad, iPod Touch and now MacBook Pro.I find the Macbook Pro was an easy transition and have installed several apps from the MacStore.I would suggest that the MacStore be expanded to allow more iPad applications to run on the Mac.Regardless of applications, I find Safari browser with the trackpad a pleasure to use in surfing the net.

Reviews.Title: A very well thought of and engineered product by Apple
Reviews.Author: InternationalTraveller
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love it, OS X Mountain Lion is a fun and efficient operating system. It is fast and easy to use. Amazon had this on a real steal deal (!) for only few hours during black friday.  Hardware and operating system are very well designed together, unbelievable how fast apps load up on Mac. With exception of few apps that don't run on Mac, I can practically use this at work. MS Office 2011 for Mac is wonderful, well worth it. Windows is a bear compared to OS X. Mac app store and games are cool. Overall very impressed, Thank you Apple and Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great deal for a Great computer
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: I was online shopping for a new computer and was pretty determined to get a MacBook Pro (after countless failures with PCs) I wanted a powerful and reliable machine that would last me a couple of years. My last PC from HP lasted less than a year before succumbing to the deadly blue-screen syndrome. Time for change...After several weeks of planning and contemplation, I finally hit a stroke of luck on Black Friday ON AMAZON, finding this gem for $962! (Originally $1,199), which trumps the student discount offered by Apple, widely believed to be the best deal around.... Anyway, I put in the order right then and there and what a great decision it turned out to be... I love it!I have only had it for less than a week but there is nothing about this computer I dont like. The speed, the simplicity, the design.. it is lightyears ahead of any PC I have ever owned. I also just purchased 16gb of RAM which I will be inserting into my mac manually within the next few days...another review on that soon to come.If you are contemplating switching from PC to Mac...Just do it. This is a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: Starting to really like the mac
Reviews.Author: Roger Savoy
Reviews.Content: Had trouble getting used to it,  but now am enjoying all it can do. I guess a old dog can get used to new things :)

Reviews.Title: First Mac computer
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be any happier with my first Apple computer. Only apple item I owned in the past was my iphone. When I switched from BB and Anroid to the iPhone I asked myself why I denied or why I waited so long to jump on the bandwagon. Now, I'm finally on the Macbook Pro bandwagon and couldn't be happier! Shipping was quick and free with Prime membership. Overall just +++++

Reviews.Title: not a new computer
Reviews.Author: online buyer
Reviews.Content: Amazon sold me "what they called a new computer which came with software on it that had been installed by a third party which impacted the operation of the computer.  I had to get Apple Customer Support to correct the problem. i do however like the computer.

Reviews.Title: I love Apple.
Reviews.Author: Alan
Reviews.Content: I gave this product 5 stars because I have been looking for a MacBook Pro for a long time and I found it here for a wonderful price. I have used this product for only 2 days, but I can't wait to use it more. I really like Mac/Apple products because of their operating system. I have been a Linux (Ubuntu and Fedora) user for a while because Windows doesn't appeal to me and it is similar to Ubuntu and Fedora but with trackpad gestures, notification center, and I can run iTunes (I couldn't get it to run on Linux). I can tweet and use Facebook from the sidebar which is really nice. I also like I have the option to push calendars, photos, and contacts to an iPad, iPod Touch, or iPhone (if I had any of those).The only thing I have had trouble with so far is transferring music to iTunes which I would have liked to do though "Home Sharing" (I used iTunes on a computer separate from my Linux computer) but I could not figure that out. I just ended up using my iPod to transfer my iTunes music and I re-downloaded my Amazon music (losing my ratings). I would recommend this product to anyone having trouble typing on their iOS products, though there are cheaper options; any new computer users, as it is easy to learn; and anyone who needs to be efficient, as the gestures make it very easy to multitask. I have not tried gaming on it but I have heard that Mac/Apple does not do games well. I plan on using my MacBook Pro for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected
Reviews.Author: Frank K. Smith "One FIne Announcer"
Reviews.Content: I have been a Mac person since 1984. I don't want to RUN a computer; I want to USE a computer. This MD101LL/A handles very much like my iMac. It's just a matter of getting used to the touch-pad commands. Thankfully I have earphones and an external amplifier for audio; the onboard speakers are just terrible. But what should I expect from a unit that is this thin and this light?

Reviews.Title: can't get enough of apple products...
Reviews.Author: Joyce Hamilton
Reviews.Content: I don't have any technical pearls to share.I can provide a review from a layman's viewpoint. This is my first apple laptop. I currently own a apple desktop which is usually used to watch movies in my studio. I have not used my IPAD  since my mac purchase. The mac is light and so compact I thought I would regret not buying a retina display, not in the least The mac pro works just fine. My main use of the mac will be keeping inventory on my jewelry supplies. Once I complete a jewelry piece taking photos and keeping track of sales. Along with email and playing angry birds.The OS is easy, and offers all kinds of surprises.

Reviews.Title: Great technical product & right size for travel
Reviews.Author: don bernier
Reviews.Content: Great size for a laptop, and very capable.  I have been PC for years but this computer is intuitive and its built in features are a great help

Reviews.Title: Amazing machine!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Ryan Harripersad
Reviews.Content: when i placed the order i began reading blogs about this model in particular and some people said that it would overheat and turn itself off but it does not do that...its an amazing machine.... fast, reliable, great battery life. it does get hot when using on a bed or sofa and gets warm on a desk....this is in an un-air conditioned room.....in air condition it gets slightly warm...... it does the tasks of an engineering student without any problems what so ever ad i really love this machine and will never go back to windows!!!..... i don't care about when people say that macs are over priced and many other negative comments. they fail to realize that you are paying for an amazing design that is pretty slim compared to some windows based laptops also it is extremely durable being made out of aluminium.....also mountain lion is really stable compared to windows and i never need to restart!...only after a os update.....also the battery life is very good...it gets me through an entire day of school without having to recharge. also the intel HD graphics 4000 is adequate for my usage...it runs most games pretty well and i have yet to try graphic intensive games on it....i figure it would run them but when the settings are minimal but it should still be playable...it also handles HD movies effortlessly....an HD movie uses about 10% battery life on average......... trust me this is an amazing machine and you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: In four words: Perfect for the price.
Reviews.Author: Brian Burton
Reviews.Content: The 13" screen is crisp and clear and just the right size for portability. At home and the office it gets plugged into an external 24" LCD screen, so built in screen size is not terribly important. Intel HD4000 graphics handle web pages, video files, photo editing (Lightroom) all fine, runs Diablo 3 acceptably, but this isn't a gamer's notebook.USB3 is AWESOME, copied from a portable USB3 drive to another portable USB3 drive at 75MB/sec (about 4 times faster then doing the same with USB2 drives.)No thoughts yet on Thunderbolt port, but I like the idea that it kind future proofs notebooks a little. (Thunderbolt is an external PCI-E bus.) Looking forward to affordable capable notebook docking stations built around thunderbolt for simplified home/office docking.About it not being a retina display: I Don't Care. Most of the time I use an external display. I also sit far enough away that I don't see individual dots anyway (internal or external screen.) And the fact that Apple is driving the 13" RMBP with the Intel4000 graphic chip seems underpowered (to me.)

Reviews.Title: Best of the best
Reviews.Author: optimusprime
Reviews.Content: I just bought this MacBook Pro a few weeks ago, and the user interface was so simple I got used to my computer in a matter of days, rather than the year it took for me to master Microsoft Windows 7. Boot time is super fast, around anywhere from 35 seconds to 1 minute. Apps launch super fast, and the 500GB HDD is more than sufficient. I usually use my Mac for school work and internet browsing, so the entry-level 13" MacBook Pro is already more than what I expected from a computer I would typically use it for. Macs hardly ever get viruses, and they are completely incompatible with existing Microsoft Windows Viruses. Furthermore, Mac OS X Mountain Lion's Gate keeper prevents the user from downloading malware and trojans, which keep your data safe and your computer running at optimum speed. The keys on the keyboard are evenly spaced and are back-lit, which make it easy to use at night and for speed writing (Typing?). Overall, the screen resolution, though non-retina, is sufficient for normal web browsing and work. I still don't get why retina displays are standard on most new iOS devices, but are only available on the MacBook Pro with Retina Display (Total cheapskate!). The thunderbolt port is awesome! It's 10gbps transfer speeds surpass even the super-fast USB 3.0 (Which also comes with the MBP). US 3.0 comes with the MBP and has transfer rates of up to 5gbps. Other ports include FireWire 800, Gigabit Ethernet, MagSafe port, Microphone jack. SDHC card reader and an optical drive for burning and reading discs.The glass track pad is large enough for Apple's highly acclaimed multi-touch gestures for scrolling through web pages with two fingers, zooming in on certain parts of certain apps by double tapping with two fingers, accessing launchpad by pinching with five fingers and using mission control by swiping up with four fingers.You can also buy one of Apple's magic mice, which connect to your Mac using Bluetooth, and also allows you to use certain multi-touch gestures such as zoom and scroll.For Windows users switching to a Mac, you can also enable right clicking (known to apple as secondary click) in the system preferences> Mouse and enabling right clicking.The unique to apple aluminium uni-body is a real beauty. It makes the MBP very durable and protects it from scratches, though you shouldn't go launching it against a wall for the sake of trying it.For Windows users who are used to using Microsoft Office, you can buy a license for the latest Microsoft Office software for Mac (Currently 2011) at any of apple's retail stores, Apple Authorised resellers, any store that sells Microsoft Office for Mac or downloading the software directly from Microsoft's website.*Users without an optical drive can skip the installation of Microsoft Office and head to the next section*To install the software, simply insert the disc provided in the package into the optical drive and open and install all the files.Enter your code printed on the back of your CD sleeve when prompted.Done! Enjoy using Microsoft Office!*For those without an optical drive (MBP with Retina Display and MB air), read this. Users with and optical drive can skip this section*To download Microsoft Office, go to Microsoft's website and download the trial version. When prompted, enter your code printed on the back of your CD sleeve to unlock the full potential of Microsoft Office 2011 for Mac.The Mac app store and iTunes store are phenomenal. The Mac app store is your one-stop shop for Mac software, though you can also download software online at your own risk. There are currently around 10,000 apps on the App store (and counting...), and billions of songs available for download fro the iTunes store. iTunes is also you default (And also your only) media player besides DVD player, or any other media players you may come across on the internet. iTunes is one of the better media players available on the market with it's simple to use User Interface. Users switching from a PC will definitely prefer iTunes to Microsoft's Windows media player.Overall, the high price of the MacBook Pro may convince users to buy a cheaper Windows PC instead. But remember, you are paying a high premium for a product with better build quality and high quality software, which is a joy to work with, considering that you can finally work in peace without having to worry about the millions of Windows viruses out in the wild attacking countless careless and oblivious PC users. I'm sure you won't regret making this purchase.

Reviews.Title: BLOWS ANY PC OUT THE WATER
Reviews.Author: NAVEEZEAL
Reviews.Content: This is my first of many MacBooks to own in the future.  I have owned at least 4 to 5 laptops and computers - but this is by far the most superior machine I have ever owned.  The speed is incredible, the build is solid, and Apple's customer service is superb.  I love it and I am so glad I "converted."

Reviews.Title: Apple does another great job!
Reviews.Author: joe9624 "Giuseppe Barletta"
Reviews.Content: To sum it up, the Macbook is one of the best computers I've ever owned. It's fast, light, and is perfect for media editing, which is mostly why I bought it in the first place. One problem does emerge though: the price. At $1899 to start, this is no cheap machine. Though you are getting an excellent machine and paying a decent price for the parts, many other machines can match if not go far past this one in terms of graphics preformance and other factors and run you a lot less. It is my belief though that if you intend to use any computer as a media editing machine, or even as a daily driver, then an OSX machine is certianly worth it, and with this now taking the top spot in screen size on the Macbook line I would definatly recommend this to anyone who asked.

Reviews.Title: 1st Mac
Reviews.Author: Noles1983
Reviews.Content: This is my first Mac and I love it. I did swap out the hard drive for a Samsung 830 SSD which I highly recommend. I also upgraded to 8gb of memory. Coming from a pc, its a bit of a learning curve but totally worth it. The build quality is second to none, i was worried about the lower screen resolution of 1280X800 but am happy to report that it is still very sharp and high quality. The trackpad is easily the best I have ever used.I was considering the macbook air due to the smaller size,  while larger this macbook pro is still easily portable and I kind of like the added weight as it feels I wont break it by just looking at it like the Air. Also, the fact i can upgrade the hard drive and memory is what made me choose this macbook pro. On the macbook air at you cannot upgrade the RAM or hard drive as its soldered onto the board.

Reviews.Title: Amazing laptop!
Reviews.Author: Evgeni A
Reviews.Content: This is amazing product. I had my PC laptop for 3 years and going to a MacBook Pro is like I leaped through time. Apple did a great job. I would recommend it to anyone. Mountain Lion is the best OS I've seen. Smooth and fast.

Reviews.Title: Glad to make the switch
Reviews.Author: Chelsea Shepard
Reviews.Content: I've used PC all my life and really wanted a mac since my cousin got one in the early 90s. The macbook pro is really responsive. If you've used an iPhone (or any touch screen device) you can use a mac's track pad no problem. I used to hate using track pads on PC's because they were always so small, I don't mind using the mac's track pad but would consider buying the magic mouse just because I'd rather use a mouse and the glass touch pad makes me nervous, I'm halfway afraid I'll break it. At the apple store I had the guy change the track pad so you don't have to click it, I can just tap it to open an app.The graphics are pretty good for someone who doesn't game a lot, if you're used to a lower end PC's graphics you'll be impressed by these graphics, although before I bought the mac I had a netbook and I was impressed by it's graphics too. If you haven't played with a mac in person, be sure to check one out somewhere if graphics are your tipping point. The screen is really nice, very clear and bright. The mac installed Microsoft office for mac with no problems. The only thing I would say that I don't like about the mac is that you cannot download more than one app at a time and it takes forever to download apps. I had to install Mountain Lion and it took a good two hours. I've noticed that if you close your open windows the app download time is less. The mac does get hot when it's charging, and when it's not it's still pretty hot (and I mean hot not warm.) Be sure to have good air flow where ever you put it. I have a fan blowing toward mine and it's been cool all morning even with the charger in. If you're going to let a little one play with it make sure you set it on a desk so it doesn't heat up your baby's lap. I've read that the mac becomes cooler as it gets more broken in, but I have no proof of that yet. I would recommend to a friend if they can afford it, if not an iPad or an iPod touch really isn't too far off. Also if you're a netbook user like I was the macbook will seem kind of heavy, but I'm sure after carrying it to and from your destinations (school, work) it will seem lighter.  One more thing, this mac does NOT come with restore disks and I am not sure if you can make them direct from the mac like you can with newer PC's, also the charging cables are made of the same cheap material as the iPhone/iPod touch cables. In my experience with the iPhone, the charging cable became very frayed and I could see the wires and aluminum in the cord. WIth a seven hour battery life I would recommend keeping the charger in one spot at home and making sure your battery is full before you leave home, or buy a second cable for use at work or school. Maybe that will save the life of the cord and keep it from being frayed from too much movement. This mac does come with an extender cable and I'm using mine right now hoping the cable will stay nice for the many years I plan on using this mac. The part where the charger connects to a mac is a magnet and a strong one at that, be sure to keep your credit cards and cell phones away from it so it doesn't erase the data. I did read that in the fine print of the mac booklet. I might have read it incorrectly, but better safe than sorry right?Hope this helps!P.S. the camera DOES NOT look hot it does on TV! It's very pixely, I don't know if you can change the quality of the camera, BUT just a heads up. It may be because the room I use it in has poor lighting, but it could also be that the camera just isn't that good. What you see on TV is probably pre-recorded using a real camera. I didn't buy the mac for it's camera or FaceTime or any of that so it's not a deal breaker for me, but it could be for someone else.

Reviews.Title: Great computer!
Reviews.Author: Jonah Koonce
Reviews.Content: Out of all the laptops I have owned, this is by far the best! I was considering buying the Air, but in reality, this one has a more powerful performance and seems much more convenient, even though it's about .20 inch thicker and 2 lbs heavier. I'm not sure if it was covered in the description, but it does have a backlit keyboard and I'm getting about an 8 hour battery life on one charge (Except I don't use this for games or videos, which obviously would drain the battery faster). It wakes in less than a second when I open the lid. The screen has an extremely high resolution that I'm very pleased with. Even though MacBooks are expensive, you will see that they are well worth the money. I have only used PCs in the past, and it's easy to see that Apple is just more advanced. You will not regret buying this computer!

Reviews.Title: 100% RECOMMENDED
Reviews.Author: angeli
Reviews.Content: The best purchase i've made in years! I'M SO HAPPY WITH MY macbook pro! I really LOVE IT!  I s a different experience

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Leonard L. Zaikowski
Reviews.Content: I started out with a Mac back in the early 90s but then switched over the windows in 1997 but now I'm glad to be back. I can't believe how quiet the hard drive is and how quick this thing boots up. So far it's running perfectly. Oh yeah, and it doesn't get hot. So far I'm happy! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: I have to say, this is my first Mac but not my first experience with them. Its simply awesome!! Very good speed starting up, and also very fast opening the apps, the features that has every mac makes them so unique that you will never want to use a PC again!! Once you go mac you never go back!!

Reviews.Title: For 1500+... I am NOT impressed
Reviews.Author: Joseph D. Land
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this computer... I really did.  Apple makes a fine product but, I have had very bad luck with them, and they are simply over priced.  For me, If this computer ran fast, stable and efficiently, it would have been worth the cost.  However, this has not been my experience so I am returning this product.I first purchased my macbook off of amazon and it ran glitchy out of the box.  The trackpad was erratic and unstable and programs crashed out of the box.  I contacted apple who gave me the typical line "well, you have to buy it directly from us to be sure it is good".  So I sent back my macbook and went through all the trouble of getting a return.  I purchased a new macbook at the inflated apple cost and got my second computer.  I soon realized that I was having more problems that were related to the operating system.  For one thing, I bought this computer to edit movies.  iMovie was a laughably bad program which was non-intuitive and hard to learn.  I shelled out the money to buy Adobe Premier which is an awesome program that I was able to figure out without seeking help.  Unfortunately, this particular program runs very glitchy on a mac.... but wait, I thought these computers were supposed to run these type of programs better than a PC.On top of that there is a massive learning curve when you are switching over from a PC to a Mac.  I don't care was Apple says, Macs are NOT more intuitive then PC's... especially when organizing files.  I ended up spending hours on the phone with apple care to learn how to perform system functions that should be intuitive enough to figure out on my own.  Now, don't get me wrong... this is NOT apple's fault.  Macs are different from PC's and they take time to learn.  However, what IS apple's fault is that they only give you a 14day return window when you order a 1500+ product from them.  This is insulting and unacceptable and is the main reason why I am sending back my second Macbook.  If I was given a more appropriate return window, I likely would have stuck with it but apple is twisting my arm to return it while I can still get my money back.So in the end, here is my final point.  Apple makes a fine product.  However, it has been my experience that shelling out the big bucks for this product DOES NOT GUARANTEE that you are going to escape the headaches of dealing with a PC.  My experience was that I had spent three times as much for buy a product that included the same headaches as a PC if not more.  Keep this in mind when you are purchasing one.  In the end, I think it is better to buy this product from amazon because they actually have a BETTER return policy than Apple themselves.

Reviews.Title: Not happy
Reviews.Author: Tina Shuemake
Reviews.Content: After one week the main board fried - I guess this happens, but not often.  We had loaded software that was purchased so it was not a good time.  Luckily Apple stood behind their product and replaced it for us, even though it was not purchased through them.  They have a customer for life.

Reviews.Title: So much for an apple product
Reviews.Author: Candor "The unbiased"
Reviews.Content: This macbook pro is nothing but pain in the neck. It keeps freezing for no apparent reason. Hours of talks and chats with apple people didn't bring any solution. I don't even use it very hard, only maybe once in two weeks and only for word processing or web surfing and it can't event do such simple tasks. This is my first experience with apple computers and I had honestly expected more. Very disappointed. Apple won't even refund or exchange it claiming that I purchased it from Amazon. Amazon says it is past the return/exchange window time, so I guess I'm stuck with it.

Reviews.Title: awesome computer, awesome customer service
Reviews.Author: Jonathan "tomatalli"
Reviews.Content: The only thing i found to not be great about the macbook pro is the graphics are lacking compared to PCs with a similar price tag but honestly gaming isn't macbook's strong point and if thats what your looking for look else where.Otherwise everything else beats PC, the software is individualized for the computer itself where as Microsoft makes one software for hundreds of computers, the build is stronger and more durable, the list goes on.Finally Amazons customer service is fantastic, my first computer had some issues with the battery life and amazon sent out a new computer right away, the current one I have works fantastic.

Reviews.Title: MacBooks just make sense
Reviews.Author: Rebecca L Kent
Reviews.Content: This MacBook is much more user friendly than any PC. It is also fast as can be... you get what you pay for... well worth the investment

Reviews.Author: mommyofchristopher "mommyofchristopher"
Reviews.Content: It was $1,299.99 just a couple of days, ago.  What's with the price increase?  Besides, the apple stocks have been falling due to lack of sales.

Reviews.Title: macs ARE worth it
Reviews.Author: m
Reviews.Content: i just got my macbook about two hours ago and finally am a believer. i always listened to the "they're too expensive for no reason" theory. now with evidence in hand i can tell i was wasting my time with pc for many years. the programs you get with this laptop are unreal. YES YES I KNOW but you can just download them to a pc. or a comparable program. but riddle me this.....will it work !!!

Reviews.Title: Grade A product & service
Reviews.Author: The1nception
Reviews.Content: It came within a week of my purchase date. No hassle and no complaints. Made life very easy. Would recommend getting the square trade warranty that goes along w/it for protection against incidental damage like drops etc.The computer itself is amazing. Very hesitant to make the switch to the "dark side". I was (and still am) of the mindset that Apple products are overpriced; however, I do understand that quality is better than quantity and w/Apple you are paying for quality. After my 3rd pc crashed in a little of 5yrs, I decided to cough up the money and make the switch. Haven't regretted it one bit. This machine is A-mazing. No complaints at all. I was worried that it would take a long time for me to get used to the Mac OS but it took me a day or so of playing w/it to get comfortable. Granted I'm sure I don't know all the ends and outs but that will come in time. The best thing for me is that everything I wished I could change/add to a PC this macbook pro has - faster boot up times, longer battery life, it even has more customization than I realized, and the camera is way ahead of any pc that I had. Let it be known that I do not write reviews often...kind of a hypocrite about that (won't take the time to write em but love reading em), but i digress. I make that point to say that I'm not by any means an Apple advocate outside of my laptop but I will give credit when it is due. An it is definitely due here.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: yosh
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical at first, mainly worried about the condition the laptop would arrive in. However, it did not have any scratches, ZERO battery cycle count (pretty surprised), and all the hardware seemed to be working perfectly. It also came with all the standard accessories and the original box. Overall, I was really happy with the purchase, aside from the fact that I still need to confirm if the laptop is under the one year apple care warranty. I've already installed 16GB of ram, and that seems to be working fine, too.

Reviews.Title: Amazing computer
Reviews.Author: jake
Reviews.Content: I am a apple fan. I love apple but unlike others That does not prevent me to not be honest about how i like it and if its good or not. But this is a time were it is truly amazing. I got this  a few days ago for school and its done everything. I bought it from best buy so it came with lion not mountin lion so I had to update it. The uptdate worked perfectly and easily I had no problums downloading or installing it it took a tad bit longer to update then my fairly new 27 in iMac but was still quick for a whole operating system. The next step for me is to install the 1141 songs and three movies I own on iTunes. For that much I was suprised how quick it went. It downloaded them all in about a hour or so while dowloding other apps lisining to internet radio seting up email ect. I have setteld into it know and it is working very well. I use it to do the average persone may do and maybe a bit more. I love the backlit keybord and suprisingly doesnt drain the battery that much and remains around apples 7 or so hours. If this is your second mac you will be suprised with how much power it has just like me it runs probibly faster than my imac (also mountain lion). And if you are switching from a pc I hilghy sugest this one. It has the best proseser and the traditional hardrive and you save some money than geting the retnia display one. So this is very good commputer and i highly suggest it.

Reviews.Title: same old mistake
Reviews.Author: nozama
Reviews.Content: I just bought the new MacBook Pro, the 13" model, and I can't believe Apple keeps making the same mistake with regard to USB ports. This laptop has only 2 USB ports, and they are both on the same side. But worst of all, they are too close to each other! I can't connect my printer AND my USB thumb drive at the same time. The ports are too close together! This was the same problem with my MacBook (circa 2007) that I just retired. When will Apple fix this design flaw? It's a nice laptop, but I have to deduct points for such an elementary design flaw.

Reviews.Title: Biggest Mistake of My Life!
Reviews.Author: Megan Leo
Reviews.Content: Within three hours of receiving my MacBook it stopped working completely. When I first started it everything seemed to be working just fine. Then all of the sudden as I was installing Photoshop it froze out and went to a white screen and you can't do anything with it. After some research I found out that this was caused by a corrupt operating system. What seemed like a fantastic deal on a laptop is now going to cost me big bucks to have fixed. I love Apple products but I will NEVER buy a refurbished product from amazon again.

Reviews.Title: Beware. Sold by Data Vision Computer Video.  Extremely poor customer service.
Reviews.Author: Powell 12
Reviews.Content: This is not sold directly by Amazon but through an intermediate company Data Vision.  They sent the package via FedEx requiring a signature.  I am at work during normal hours so I contacted Fed-Ex to go and pick it up in person. FedEx said they could not do it because Data Vision requested delivery at the address and require a signature. I called Amazon and they gave me the number to contact data Vision.  The customer service by Data Vision Computer Video was very bad. The person taken the call was very rude and he said he could try but really there nothing he could do. I requested to talk to supervisor and this person was even worse. In short, if you have any problem with this product good luck dealing with Data Vision.  I would not order again from them. They claim in the phone message that they are one of the largest companies. It may be true I do not know, but most certainly they have a terrible customer service.  If they cannot fix a very minor problem for the delivery, what can they fix?

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: Gladys NAJERA
Reviews.Content: Good very good Thank You God Bless You. I'm from México and I appreciate your good work. Thank You !

Reviews.Title: Apple MacBook Pro
Reviews.Author: Herbert L Smith
Reviews.Content: This was a Graduation Gift to my Granddaughter, she is in love with this computer, it is everything she wanted in a laptop. She is entering Med.School and the computer of choice Apple MacBook Pro. what can I say!

Reviews.Title: Macbook
Reviews.Author: Kareman
Reviews.Content: I got this for my dad. It was so easy to use for him. It was very simple. He liked it.

Reviews.Title: perfection at its best
Reviews.Author: Fabian Quintero
Reviews.Content: it's the very best of mac computers and for me that never had a mac before i find it incredible that things that one can do and it' so easy to handle and easy to use

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: LowMetallurgy
Reviews.Content: Why oh why did I ever use PC?!  Extremely pleased with this purchase.  Laptop practically works without any problems and fits my needs well.

Reviews.Title: Apple MacBook Pro MD103LL/A 15.4-Inch Laptop (OLD VERSION)
Reviews.Author: Robert Bolden "Rauf Bolden"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item from the seller because of his or her high rating and I was not disappointed.  Everything arrived and functioned as advertised.  I put in the HDD from my old Mac let it re-boot (about 15 minutes), upgraded to 10.9 and everything worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Like the connectivity, like the display. All I have had before were windows laptops and I must say, this is better than all of them!

Reviews.Title: "An Apple a day will keep the doctor away"
Reviews.Author: Bo Phenevongsa
Reviews.Content: Another great product from Apple as always. The price is higher than most lab top out there; however, he/she will get what they paid for, which is a great computer.

Reviews.Title: Great Deals till the Internet Sales Tax reared it's head.
Reviews.Author: Fred Devico
Reviews.Content: Deal of the year. $999.00 Tax free. Then Big Gov put an end to tax free internet sales. Thanks keep squeezing us.

Reviews.Title: Its a Mac
Reviews.Author: Monique Beurlot Auzenne
Reviews.Content: Not much to say except Macs are what they are using at our highschool and it just made sense to replace our computer with a Mac when the time came.

Reviews.Title: MacBook Pro
Reviews.Author: Jkraze
Reviews.Content: I was a little weary to buy a computer off Amazon, but then I did it and now I have a sweet upgrade! Lovin my new Mac and it works just fine

Reviews.Title: High quality, fast performance, and easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: Having a laptop while in college is essential to success and may contribute to overall achievement. A laptop provides easy access to Internet resources and keeping track of assignments that need to be due. Many modern homework assignments require using Internet or having to do research for classes. The Apple 13-inch MacBook Pro laptop is very practical for college students because of its easy to use features, fast performance, and new modern design. Often homework assignments require using a computer, which the MacBook Pro assists with because it provides Internet that can give information for research. In my opinion, Safari, the Internet browser that comes with the MacBook Pro is very fast and is extremely easy to use. As a result of having user-friendly features, Safari has a top sites page that contains frequently used websites. Also, in addition to top sites, there is unified smart search field that takes you right to the web page and fills in the entire URL when you enter a web address. MacBook's built-in sharing feature provides access to various web pages without having to leave Safari. By just clicking the Share button, you can choose how to send a web page by using Mail, which then gives you four options. Also the MacBook Pro has a fast performance that helps college students complete their work. The MacBook Pro provides many features, such as a dual-core Intel Core i5 that allows users to be able to take their laptops on the go. Also it has a 22-nanometer processor, cache, and graphics processor, and a fast 1600MHz memory controller on a single chip. Also applications like Aperture and Final Cut Pro help make work go smoother and faster because they automatically increase the speed of the active cores up to 3.7GHz. Hyper-threading technology allows two threads to run at the same time on each core and can get more jobs done. In addition to its high-quality features, it has an amazing new modern design that adds to the MacBook's overall easy usage. The new design contributes to assisting college students in need of getting work done because of its LED backlight technology that makes the display continuously bright. Also, on top of the screen is the built-in FaceTime HD camera that can be used to talk face to face through the laptop to loved ones or friends. The multi-touch trackpad is the button itself, which results in more room to click everywhere, which personally is nice because it is easier to double click when needed. Another valuable feature of design is the MagSafe Power Adapter's magnetic design, which is made to disconnect harmlessly from the port in case someone trips over the wire so it does not cause the laptop to fall. In conclusion, the 13-inch MacBook Pro is a wise investment for college students and any users interested in an easy-to-use productive laptop to help get work done. Having a portable computer is beneficial because it provides a place to store various information. Students looking for an all-in-one tool that can assist them in numerous aspects should definitely look into the Apple MacBook Pro laptop line. Its easy to use features, quick performance, and sleek design all contribute to the MacBook's overall productivity.
